Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time, found it very hard to leave!”
Reviews.Author: DublinSonia
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time, especially loved the conversations we had with Victor and the culinary team who clearly take pride in their work! Food was amazing, beautiful garden and very comfortable bed. We will recommend it to friends who live in the Bay Area.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in an elegant town but it is not completely perfect”
Reviews.Author: Richard654
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Napa valley and we booked two nights at the Bardessono after reading some impressive reviews. The hotel has beautifully landscaped grounds and contains a lot of recycled materials in its construction; personally I worry about the useful life of the rusty sheets of metal that are sprinkled throughout. the hotel. Our King Spa room was all that we could have desired and the Reception, valet parking and staff serving breakfast were very friendly and helpful throughout our visit. The rooftop pool is a very nice addition to the hotel. Our only real concern was the rather strange dinner menu in the hotel restaurant which consisted of some strange combinations of ingredients with every main course dish which did not appeal to our European palates at all. As a result we did not eat dinner in the hotel at all during our stay. This was not really a problem as there are several other good restaurants within walking distance. Our favourite was Bistro Jeanty which serves excellent French dishes, including the best onion soup starter that I have ever tasted. The Bouchon bakery is less than 250 yards from the hotel and is an excellent place to pick up tea, coffee, sandwiches and cakes, however the breakfast served in the hotel was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Among the best anywhere”
Reviews.Author: BarneyMcGee
Reviews.Content: This review is long overdue but my wife and I stayed at Bardessono during the week leading up to our wedding in St. Helena last September. I just can't say enough great things about this property. Service was absolutely phenomenal and the grounds were the perfect calm eye of the storm from the rest of the chaos of that week. Huge bonus points to the valet that picked up my wife and me in St. Helena the night of our wedding when a slight logistical error left us stranded at our own after-party. The rooms are of course amazing as well. Nicely appointed, spacious, and obvious attention to detail. When we had a minor glitch with our tv it was handled quickly and with overflowing apologies. Our dogs also appreciated the quiet trail that runs around the backside of the property . We will always remember our great stay here and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: davidandrose1
Reviews.Content: While this was only our second stay at Bardessono, we stay in Yountville 1-3x year and this is by far our favorite hotel, if price isn't an object. Location is perfect, just steps from Bouchon bakery, but every hotel in Yountville is close to something that's excellent. The staff here is friendly, professional, and invitingly-helpful. The guest rooms are among the brightest and best laid-out hotel spaces we've had the opportunity to enjoy, with an eco-friendly approach. Have not used the spa, but the pool was heated to a very comfortable temperature - frequently a pool is cool and one needs to use the hot tub if you want to warm up. Here both were perfect temperatures on a cooler April day.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in paradise”
Reviews.Author: TCTraveler72
Reviews.Content: Yountville is sort of like an adult Disney...food, luxury and wine. The Bardessono is outstanding. Very attentive, not intrusive service, the guys at the valet always running to satisfy any need, the friendly smiles, helpful service, beautiful landscaping and outstanding/comfortable rooms all add up to a great place to camp out for any trip to Napa. The restaurant (Lucy) was inventive and extremely good (the steak and foie gras dish amazing). I'd highly recommend this hotel. For true spa seekers, though, bear in mind that spa treatments are in your guest room and not in a separate "spa" area...the room is so perfect and large this is definitely not an issue...how luxurious is it to have a couples treatment and then be left alone in your room without worrying about getting showered/dressed and transporting back to your room...

Reviews.Title: “An exquisite favourite”
Reviews.Author: roughrob
Reviews.Content: I loved this place; from start to finish the experience was sophisticated and effortless. The Bardessono is beautifully laid out, and managed to feel bright, airy and private at the same time â€“ even with central Yountville on the door step. Following a very swift check in we were whisked via the bar and outdoor area, passed some of the many sculptures and water features to our room. Our room was well proportioned with high quality fixtures and fittings, a luxurious bathroom, Sony entertainment system and a big comfortable bed. It would be very easy to spend days here and forget the outside world. There was a small secluded patio area with rattan furniture ornamental plants and an outdoor shower reminiscent of properties in the Caribbean and Asia. There are no in room coffee facilities but instead they pour complimentary coffee each morning in the lounge area, which provided a good opportunity to soak up the atmosphere and chat with fellow guests. We made full use of the complimentary bikes, they have a good range to choose from including electrically assisted for the less energetic â€“ the valetâ€™s were very helpful in setting everything up and pointing us in the direction of the nearest vineyard. The staff are professional, welcoming and knowledgeable about both the property and attractions in the surrounding area, of which there are many â€“ so many in fact that we didnâ€™t get the opportunity to sample the Bardessono spa or pool. In short this place appeals to all of the senses, we were sad to leave but look forward to going back and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive!!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyInNJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoy celebrating our anniversary each year with trips to romantic destinations with hotels that are known for impeccable service. This year we reserved our suite at the Bardessono strictly based on the reviews on tripadvisor. Well, we were beyond pleased with the EXCELLENT service and SOPHISTICATION of this hotel...from the reservation experience, check-in procedure, suite amenities, staff friendliness and overall pleasant atmosphere this turned out to be one of the best hotels in which we have stayed (and we have stayed at some of the very best). We HIGHLY recommend this to everyone that checks this site and is looking for a memorable Napa experience. I also have to mention the in room massages and pedicure that we had...we felt pampered and the staff were so gracious. Finally, an added bonus is that you can walk to all the best restaurants: French Laundry, Bouchon (our favorite...have the duck leg confit), Redd etc.... Thanks to the Bardessonno staff for creating for us another wonderful anniversary celebration....well done!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: fauxceo
Reviews.Content: Bardessono is by far the nicest spa retreat I've ever stayed at. Love the modern decor, it is quiet and yet located walking distance from amazing restaurants in Yountville. We are already planning our next stay there. My only disappointment was the in-room manicure. Super expensive and not great----the polish didn't even stay on 24 hours!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Woodai
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to celebrate my 40th birthday. The property is located right in the heart of Yountville where all the really good restaurants are located within walking distance. We were greeted by a friendly guy who brought us to our room right after we checked in. Even though it rained all day the room was perfect. The fireplace warmed up the room, I also had an in-room massage. In the evening, we walked to Hurley's for dinner (right across the street). We had breakfast at the Lucy's, the hotel restaurant - it was really yummy! Too bad we didn't get a chance to try to jacuzzi located above the spa or the complimentary 4-hour Lexus test drive! I had a wonderful time and would return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly beds”
Reviews.Author: cbergmann
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous stay at Bardessono, in spite of some pretty dreadful March weather in Napa. The beds are incredibly comfortable, the steam shower was wonderful on a cold rainy day and the bartenders were incredibly helpful in finding just the right beverage to top off the day and in helping us make winery choices. Perfect walk to everything location in Yountville. My only complaint is that the rooms could use a few drawers to stash your stuff (the shelves in the closet are a little awkward). I've stayed at other Napa locations and encountered high prices, iffy service and lots of road noise. Bardessono is head and shoulders above the rest.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Girltime
Reviews.Content: Very convienent, walk to restaurants, great staff. don't miss the public toilets in the lobby! A bit pricey, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull stay AGAIN!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mina f
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had originally stayed here January of 2010 for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon on route to Hawaii. We had such a wonderfull stay (and the town of Yountville is so pleasant) that we decided to come back once again. When we came in the second time we were treated at the door like old friends :). They welcomed us back, hand it us each a glass of wine and had us booked within seconds. (They also upgraded our room to the steam spa suite; which was also awesome). Camille at concierge was aaamaaaazzzing, I had wanted to do a limo tour for 2 days. She was very knowledgable and friendly and setup Everything for me. This hotel will do everything in their power to make your stay as pleasant as possible. From turn down service to driving you anywhere in the town of Yountville. With a beautiful smile on their faces. WE love our napa wine, and everytime we are their exploring we will definetly be staying here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! MF

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and great location”
Reviews.Author: Mom2BoysTwo
Reviews.Content: We loved Bardessono!! You can't beat the great location... we walked to dinner, wine tasting, shopping and Bouchon Bakery. The rooms were large and private. We had a nice balcony, but unfortunately it rained most of our stay so we were unable to enjoy it. Great little touches like a complimentary glass of wine upon arrival and complimentary coffee in lounge every morning. Service and staff were outstanding. We didn't want to leave this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best hotel stays- EVER!”
Reviews.Author: kikicorbs
Reviews.Content: I know that a lot has already been said about Bardessono- but it is so amazing that I just had to write my own review. Bardessono rates as one of our top two hotel stays ever (the other being in Europe). The hotel grounds are immaculate and instantly transport you away from the craziness of daily life. It is simply beautiful- zen indeed. We were often the only people on the rooftop pool and loved how secluded it was. What makes Bardessono really stand out is the customer service. Knowing it was our anniversary, we were upgraded to a steam shower suite and champagne/chocolates were awaiting us. The wine and food suggestions at the bar were spot on. We had massages in our room- absolutely fabulous experience- you must do it! I wanted to take an early morning walk and was given the best route that took me through scenic vineyards and pastures. On top of it all- they are LEEDS certified and very eco-friendly. Quite simply put, Bardessono is pure perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Max878
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately for our first trip to Napa it rained all week. Despite this, the spa suite at the Bardessono felt like home. Outdoor patio, fireplace, outdoor shower, european tub, room for in room couples massages, 24 hour room service, what more could you want. They have bicycle rentals for free and Yountville fitness center access as well which is less than a 5 minutes walk away. In the heart of Yountville the best of Napa's restaurants are minutes away. For breakfast there is a cafe just past the Yountville post office and for lunch try the Mustard Grill on 29 North. The pool is on the second story and perfect for doing laps and the cabanas are available for lounging. Lucy's restaurant should not be overlooked. The service is attentive but laid back and the food is quite good. The hotel also has a rotating art collection that is interesting. The hotel is in between Highway 29 and the Silverado Trail. It is easy to bike to either and enjoy the beauty of the area. A shout out to the valets. They really made our stay feel like home. Always available for ideas on things to do especially since the weather was poor, they really seemed like they wanted us to have a good time. I would definitely stay here if you are looking for a resort and think you are going to spend a lot of time on property. Keep in mind this place is not very cost effective. However its worth it. Also, we did not make use of it but they have free Lexus hybrids to take out for 3 hours at a time. If you are out and about all day then the bed and breakfasts are probably the better deal.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST "Zen Luxury" experience in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: michifreyre
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best experiences I have had in a long time at a hotel, and I travel almost weekly for business. The room was beautiful, spacious & zen-like -- I find it a fantastic value for the rate! My boyfriend and I felt an immediate sense of calm from the second we walked into the room. The service was fantastic. My boyfriend got sick and needed salt & vinegar for gargles. The staff immediately brought a bottle of each and didn't charge us. After that, when we called or went down to reception, everyone asked him how we was feeling. It was so special. Another day, we came back from a long day and wanted hot tea. We went to the lounge and asked for some tea. While they don't typically serve at the lounge, they brought us a teapot and didn't even charge us. It was the perfect end to the day! Finally, the whole wheat pancakes in room service menu are AMAZING!! I want to come back to the hotel just to have them again. We sat in our terrace and enjoyed them. One of the happiest moments of our vacation. It was a 5-star experience all around. We will always stay here when we come to Napa and I will recommend it to everyone I know. THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth R
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Napa was so special because we stayed in this wonderful Hotel! The rooms are amazing, comfortable, spacious, luxurious. The Concierge's recommendations were incredible. Try the French Toast for breakfast it was perfect! We loved the location, we walked everywhere in Yountville.

Reviews.Title: “Green, Chic, and Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: ARBarnes
Reviews.Content: I found Bardessono online and could not find a reason not to go. We arrived and were not disappointed! In fact, we were wonderfully impressed. The check-in process was simple, had a glass of wine offered, and we were taken on a quick tour of the place and escorted to our room. We were shown all the amenities of the room and the luggage was brought up soon thereafter. The hotel bar was great. You could have a cocktail if you were tired of wine, or of course they had a wonderful selection of wines as well. Bardessono is within walking distance to all things Yountville. The concierge service was outstanding. We were given lifts (I had a broken foot) to several places in the hotel's Lexus, and got several tips on not-to-miss wineries and just general information. The rooms and the hotel were like none we've ever seen. To think you can have this luxurious of a place and it's LEED certified is quite impressive. However, I think the service and the staff is the best asset of the entire Bardessono experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very Green and Cool”
Reviews.Author: Amicis_Tours_Napa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an experience by itself and one of the best lessons that sustainable can also be stylish and beautiful. Located in downtown Yountville, the food capitol of Napa Valley, this is a Platinum Leeds property showing their high committment to the health of the environment. The place is beautiful and comfortable, they just redid the restaurant, as if being steps from California's best places to eat wasn't enough, and the staff is first rate, relaxed yet attentive. It is one of my two favorite places to recommend in Yountville and an absolute gem, the other is the Yountville Hotel. It is a little expensive but in line with the other places in town. On our website we have a very good video we did over the winter time for the Napa Valley Wine Tour App from Sutro Media.

Reviews.Title: “Love this modern place”
Reviews.Author: Snyderp
Reviews.Content: We,ve stayed here several times and would always look to return as our first choice in the whole Napa area. Yes, it,s pricey. But the rooms are very large and all that I,ve been in have a private patio, a huge tub and shower, and wonderful, surprising amenities. Some rooms have a bathroom that is spacious enough for an in room massage. Then you can just follow up with a nice hot bath right there. The rooms have fridges with stocked water. Room service food is awesome. And the main building has a very nice restaurant and bar area and outdoor seating area. Be sure to use the cool bathrooms in the lobby area. I think this place is perfect. Right across the street is Hurley,s restaurant which is amazing - a cozy place with great food exceptionally done. Also there is the Bouchon Bakery nearby for coffee and pastries! What could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ANewmark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Bardessono for a week in March. The grounds, staff and accomodations were excellent. Our room was spacious and the spa bathrooms really are as good as advertised. The hotel is centrally located in Yountville, so just a short walk to Bouchon and even the French Laundry. If you are thinking of Napa, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service before we even stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ZionHiker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been looking forward to visiting Bardessono for "Taste of Yountville" on March (24th). We made our reservations months ago and we really looking forward to the weekend...Imagine my surprise when I realized I had booked the WRONG weekend!! I worried all weekend that we would not be able to make the change as we were in the 14 day cancellation period. On Monday, I contacted the hotel and spoke to their GM. He quickly put things in motion and within a few hours had rescheduled our stay..and our massages, without complaint! Everything was done via a few email messages and a new confirmation sent. Whew! I cant wait for our weekend stay but am already impressed by the service of their management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bardessono”
Reviews.Author: lstewart123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bardessono for a long weekend in early February. We were really impressed! I wasn't sure what to expect since it was a LEED certified resort. In other words, I feared SOMETHING had to give in the way of creature comforts in order to attain this environmentally friendly status, but I couldn't have been more wrong. Everything about the room was luxurious, from the bedding to the bathroom. We loved the huge soaking tub and used it every day. The room was really quiet, although I did notice a few mornings that there was some traffic noise in the form of a service truck backing up (beep, beep, beep) in the parking lot nearby, but we were already awake so I didn't care. However, it probably would have bothered me had I been a late sleeper. I chalk it up to staying in a town rather that out in the valley where nothing else is around. The service was really phenomenal as well. Everyone, and I do mean everyone, that we encountered truly had a congenial, can-do attitude. It was on par with other 5 star resorts we have stayed at (previous stays in Napa were at Auberge du Soleil & Calistoga Ranch). We ate breakfast at Lucy two mornings, and had drinks at the bar several times. The food was fantastic, and the cocktails were yummy and inventive. One of the other things we loved about staying here was being in Yountville. There were lots of great places close by, and we took advantage of that by walking to most of them. In particular, we really loved Ma(i)sonry, Bistro Jeanty, and Redd Wood. Actually the night we were heading to Redd Wood was a bit chilly, and the gentleman at the valet offered to give us a quick ride to the restaurant. I felt silly since it was so close, but took him up on it since I was freezing & in high heels. He told us to give him a call when we were ready to come home, as well. We really appreciated that. We did use the spa one day, and the massages were fantastic. The spa was a little on the small side, but hey, this isn't Vegas. We hung out up by the pool for an hour before our treatments since the weather was so nice & that was very relaxing. All in all, I would most definitely recommend this hotel. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: superusta
Reviews.Content: We booked Bardessono on Gilt.com for our 4 year anniversary and were so amazed by the customer service and the hotel. We could not be happier with what we've got. This hotel is definetely worth every penny. Our room was on the ground level Steam Spa Suite and it had a large bathroom. My husband enjoyed his steam shower, and I enjoyed my jet bath everyday. Beautiful gas fireplace and the bed was so comfortable! The pool was awesome as well. We also had a couple's massage and was the best we've ever had!!! It was excellet. We would love to stay here again if our budget allows! LOVED everything about this hotel:)

Reviews.Title: “Zen California Cool”
Reviews.Author: MarcosParis
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, well planned outdoor spaces and friendly staff make for a great base for a Napa Valley visit. Restaurant is enjoyable and serves good lunch and evening meals - breakfast needs a rethink with notably better bread options.

Reviews.Title: “29th Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Tim C
Reviews.Content: We spent our 29th Anniversary at bardessono and loved it...the room was fantastic, two sided fireplace, jetted tub, and best of all two massage tables and excellent masseuses. The bar served fresh unique cocktails and dinner was amazing, course after course. Service was five star from the pre arrival communications, valet, check in, and wait staff. We've stayed before for the weekend and even though we live in the valley we'll be back again!

Reviews.Title: “First review for a reason”
Reviews.Author: Steve B
Reviews.Content: My very first on-line review of ANYTHING! Let's get started....Every single staff member treated me and wife like royalty. Engaging, caring, and genuine in wanting to make this an amazing experience. They succeeded. The small city of Yountville, with the addition of this exceptional hotel, actually got even more intimate and special. Dinner at Lucys, drinks at the bar, coffee on the patio and a bike ride through the vineyards was magical. Being "green" worried me as it felt like I might have to settle on comfort. Just the opposite. Space, lights, and layout were best in class. Already looking to book the next trip. Service-Service-Service.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best.”
Reviews.Author: jeffk911
Reviews.Content: This is some hotel. Let me begin this review by pointing out I was dreading this Napa trip. Never been before and truly never had any intention of ever going. Why? 2 reasons. I hated the movie Sideways and I just don't like wine. (Ok, Maybe a spritzer.) So the idea of going to a place that was all about making and drinking wine seemed like a total waste of money and time. (Hmmm, a trip to Lynchburg, Tenn for a visit to the Jack Daniels distillery, might be in the works.) So why did I go? My wife wanted to - Enough said. It was amazing! What a win/win for me. The B, as I affectionately call it, was everything and more. The rooms spotless, modern and comfortable. Beds, electronics, accoutrements, etc. everything the other reviewers have described. Customer Service is king (esp Rebecca, Camille & Vinnie on Cocktail Shaker). Anything we might have needed was provided. Any speed bumps we encountered were handled like lightening. Like the guest in the room above who began a loud and vigorous P90X workout. And this guy had stamina, it went on until 10am. One mention of this to the front desk and problem solved. Moved quickly and without hassle. Another big plus was location. We could walk to Bouchon, Bistro Jeanty, and a lovely small market. (They are also happy to drive and pick you up in one of their lovely hybrid Lexus sedans.) And for those of you who like to follow up a day of wine tasting with some heavy duty cocktails...The bar (Lucy's) made some delicious and exotic concoctions. Great place, great stay, great time.

Reviews.Title: “Ten stars!”
Reviews.Author: Nandy5
Reviews.Content: There are so many fine things to say about this hotel. Service and welcome are superlative. Location cannot be beat. Hotel accommodations are spacious, clean and luxurious. Benefit of "green" footprint gives an extra dimension. Spa treatment wonderful. Bikes, coffee, pool add to a total experience. This hotel has a boutique type feel so don't expect a huge campus. We left relaxed and totally satisfied with a truly great hotel. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Bliss”
Reviews.Author: NACRAC
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Bardessono was blissful. If you want chintz and ruffles, this is not the place. If you prefer a zen experience, then make your reservation now. This is relaxation at it's finest. On our second visit in 2 years, we were still very impressed with the staff, grounds, and the interiors. From the moment you arrive, you're greeted by gracious, smiling car parking staff. That first impression goes a long way. We've been to many 5 star hotels where the parking staff were harried, gruff and often pretentious. None of that here....from anyone on the staff. All of our needs were met with a smile. The bedroom and bathroom were beautifully appointed, with the extra bonus of an outdoor shower. The restaurant has undergone some changes and is still in the process of settling in, however, our breakfasts were outstanding. The eggs were so fresh they tasted like they were just brought in from the nest and the brioche french toast is not to be missed. As with the other staff members, the restaurant staff were very gracious in making sure we were satisfied and enjoyed our food. The location in Yountville is wonderful for all your outings, whether walking, biking or driving to wineries in any direction. I hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Very Upscale and Relaxing Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: Ryla_M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bardessono for Valentine's weekend. Our room was very large, with a huge attached bathroom with jucuzzi tub for two, private toilet, 2 vanities and matching sinks, 2 closets. Immediately when you enter the room the powered shades sense your presence and magically begin to raise. Very cool! We had a king bed with white sheets and cover. A flat screen tv, and stereo in two rooms for your I pod. Gas fireplace for ambiance. Pull-out couch and coffee table. The balcony is immense with chairs and potted plants and privacy area. I believe on ground level some rooms have a private out-door shower. The weather was too cool to partake that feature, but on a return trip I will definately book that type of room. There is a bar and restaurant on premises as well as full-service spa. I love the location of this resort as it is in the heart of Yountsville by all shopping, and restaurants. The town is really cute and charming and well worth walking around. I love Yountsville, and this resort is going to be a must stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Just not my style”
Reviews.Author: Gardine
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that there is nothing wrong with Bardessono whatsoever. It is a nice place in a great location. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They provided free bikes for us to ride to wineries, the bartender even emailed me a recipe for a specialty drink that we loved. My only problem was that I'm not really into the minimalistic modern vibe that they have. To me, it's not that relaxing. If you are into that kind of thing, you will definitely love Bardessono. I would also say that it's a little pricey for what it is. Also, another individual thing, but found the bed uncomfortable and the room was bright in the morning. Nonetheless, we definitely enjoyed our stay. Personally I wouldn't go back, but I would potentially suggest it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, thoughtfull, relaxing subtle luxury”
Reviews.Author: Taloli
Reviews.Content: We had such a wonderful experience at Bardessono. -Location is amaizing as some of the wine country's if not the worlds best restaurants are walking distance. -The lodge like accommodations are pure understated luxury. Simple but thoughtfull every detail well thought out and tastefully displayed. -the whole hotel mantra or mission seams to be environmentally conscious and sustainable they make Being green super stylish. -The staff where friendly, knowledgable and made our over all stay even better. The Conceirge team were amaizing, they even placed us in the hard to get into French Laundry's waiting list and luckily we got a booking and ended up going. Since we only stayed two nights and wanted to get too see as much as we could of napa and the wineries Brett the somalier from Lucy the house restaurant was amaizing! He gave us a Brief history, recommendations and info on what to expect when we went to the wineries, we would have been overwhelmed without him. -The Complimentary morning coffee at the Lounge is a Wonderful start to the day as was the In room Hot to stone massage ! -Finally upon check out, as the valet pulled out our car, we had a lovely going away gift waiting for us in the ..It was a Bardessono reusable water bottle .. Love the experience.. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay any other place. Absolute best!”
Reviews.Author: texans67
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love Bardessono. The food, atmosphere, and rooms are to die for. Roof top pool. We just feel in love. The location is great. We went biking, and really enjoyed everthing that wine country had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Bardessono is beyond words ...... And this is what I have to say!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah K
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this was a perfect experience. We went to eat at The French Laundry and we were not expecting to be as obsessed with this hotel as we are now. They are LEED certified as well which we all should be more aware of. Everything is organic , environmentally friendly and beyond decadent. The room was very clean and had an amazing view outside from every room. All of the windows were equipped with remote control blinds too which was pretty nice ( not that we used them). We took advantage of the complimentary bicycles everyday we stayed there and rode around yountville to see the vineyards which was breathtaking. Of course they equip you with water bottles ( wouldn't want you to get dehydrated ). I didnt have a chance to go to the spa but I did purchase a bottle of the lotion they have in the rooms which are made specifically for them of course. I highly recommend purchasing some for home if you go it smells lovely. We also ate at Lucy and had the Sunday dinner ( 5 course set menu ). The food was incredible and of course the wine was amazing. Our server was sweet , professional and entertaining. Bottom line, if you're planning a trip anywhere near yountville you HAVE to stay at Bardessono. You will not be disappointed. We are going back in january ..... Potentially sooner. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: t m
Reviews.Content: Awesome experience. Everybody that we came in contact with during our stay did an amazing job! My wife and I were engaged in Napa, so we decided to make a trip back for our 1 year anniversary. I stumbled across Bardessono when I was looking for a hotel and fell in love with it. The hotel is even nicer in person. I would 100% recommend this hotel to anybody that is looking for a place to stay. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “One word-Amazing”
Reviews.Author: andrepaulGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here around Christmas and we we blown away as soon as we drove down the driveway. This place is a design statement right from the signage out the front. We were greeted by a glass of local wine and very lovely staff. Every effort is made here to make you feel relaxed and pampered. The resort has an Eco feel without scrimping on luxury and is perfectly situated within walking distance of everything Yountville has to offer. We stayed in the steam spa suite which was amazing and comes with a massive spa bath in the open plan bathroom. One afternoon we hired the complimentary bikes and rode thought the vineyards as the sun set. This is a truely magical place.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms; relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Alex K
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel for a special occasion. The outdoor showers are a great touch and the spacious and modern rooms are the perfect place to relax in wine country.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, and new hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeluxeTraveler
Reviews.Content: We travel to Napa often and enjoyed our stay at the Bardessono. The room and bathroom were very large, plenty of room for our family of three. My husband and I took our 12 year old son with us. He had his own alcove with a queen bed. We had breakfast in the restaurant and it was very good. The daily maid service was a little slow. We would be out all day and come back and have to call to have our room made up. They may have been fully booked. I asked for a non-pet room so we would be away from any rooms with barking dogs and they accomodated my request. We had a nice quiet room. A very clean, modern and luxurious hotel. A little pricey, but would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised about how wonderful this hotel was”
Reviews.Author: davemann17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel a lot, and thought we would take a local trip up to Yountville. The Bardessono was the perfect place to get away! Immediately when we pulled into the front of the hotel, we were greeted by not only a valet, but also by a concierge that walked us to the registration desk, and we were both handed a glass of wine along the way. (Talk about service!) We are not huge fans of modern hotels, we generally prefer those that are boutiques...but this hotel has opened our minds. The rooms are huge and extremely private, there is plenty of room for two people in the bathroom, and then with that indoor/outdoor shower...We definitely wished that we had stayed longer. And I am also a fan of the little technological things that the rooms had to offer...i.e. the shades to the bedroom being controlled by a switch, the lights and TV automatically going off when you are not in the room, etc. Oh, and I forgot to mention the rooftop pool and jacuzzi. It was so adorable that we had to make sure that they were both used before we left. Now there aren't a lot of rooms at this hotel (I think around 65ish), so your stay is going to be extremely private. I know that others have commented on the price of the hotel, but I felt that the service warranted the price...And I cannot say that about a lot of hotels. One other comment... Yountville is a quaint town, and the Bardessono is centrally located to everything the town has to offer. We walked everywhere, and I do love when we are able to do that while on a vacation... I could go on raving about this hotel, but I think there are other wonderful reviews here to highlight other great aspects of this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Napa Valleyâ€¦Will Never Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: Katie R
Reviews.Content: Bardessono was truly the best hotel that I have ever stayed at. They made every effort to ensure that our trip was perfect and went out of their way to make us feel like important guests. We had to come in a day early because of bad weather in San Francisco and they not only gave us a discount on the extra night, but upgraded us to a spa suite for all three nights upon arrival. The rooms were HUGE with a beautifully decorated living room as well as as equally large bathroom. I have never been at a hotel where the bathroom is the same size as the room! It is large enough to get a couples massage so that you never even need to leave your room (if not for the wine tasting!). It also has a gorgeous patio that if the weather was better we would have spent all our time. It location is also perfect as it is in walking distance to all of the best restaurants in Napa Valley (Bottega, French Laundry, Bouchon.) They just reopened their new restaurant Lucy, and it was truly delicious. I would compare it to any of the best restaurants in Yountville. I always wanted to stay at Auberge de Soleil but after staying at Bardessono I don't think I will ever stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with some room for improvement on service”
Reviews.Author: IrishShannita
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked four nights here recently, and we were really impressed with the design and overall upkeep of the hotel. Our room was very spacious, with a quaint private courtyard, and the best part was the incredible bathroom, jacuzzi and steam shower. We loved relaxing in the jacuzzi and unwinding after a day of wine tasting in with a nice hot steam. The location could not be better - just a short walk to a number of world-class restaurants (Redd, Bottega, French Laundry) and a short drive to Mustards Grill (this and Redd were our two favorite meals of the trip). We loved the free service the hotel provides to all guest - first-rate bikes to tour the wine region, including electric bikes which really helped after hours of cycling on the Silverado Trail. The valets who greeted us every day could not have been nicer and the sommelier at the restaurant was very knowledgeable and friendly. We've stayed at incredible hotels around the world (Relais & Chateaux in several countries including the amazing El Colibri in Cordoba, Argentina and Hotel Explora in Chilean Patagonia), and in terms of design, this hotel was very impressive. Where it fell short, however, was the level of service. We recognize, to be fair, that this may have been due to the fact we went in the "off season" for Napa and for the first few days we were one of a few guests at the hotel. Still, we would have liked a "tour" of the property upon arrival and an explanation of all the services provided (we were never told, for example, about the free shuttle service to restaurants in the area), and it would have been helpful to know before we arrived that the onsite restaurant was closed for renovation. Room service was very expensive and was spotty (we ordered a cheese and pate platter when we arrived but they forgot to include any bread) with regard to service. We so wanted to fall in love with Bardessono based on all the reviews we had read, but we could only manage to really love the property and say to ourselves, "if only" they had not neglected so many little touches that make a stay at this type of hotel so memorable. Forgetting to clean our room (we walked in after a long day of wine tasting to find it was still unmade) was one of those things you just never expect at a place that charges you $500 USD a night. Again, in fairness to the Bardessono, Rachel at the front desk, when she learned about this, immediately told us to go to the bar area and have a drink on the hotel while I room was being cleaned and then sent a plate of delicious homemade cookies to our room later that evening. That was the kind of special touch we'd been hoping for the entire stay, but it came on the final evening. I suspect that we stayed during an "off" week at the Bardessono, and that is we returned, things would be more consistent with the other rave reviews it has received (and which we read before booking!).

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Relaxing Wonderful Top Notch Experience”
Reviews.Author: lisalisa24
Reviews.Content: We travel quite a bit - and have stayed at some wonderful places in Napa/Yountville - and Bardessono was the absolute best for many reasons: 1 - The accomodations - it was SO QUIET and the room is HUGE and accomodating with a sitting area and patio. The bathroom is HUGE and has 2 separate sinks on 2 separate sides - 2 closets - everything is immaculately CLEAN. While we're not seeking a 'green' experience - I have to admit that the environmental accomodations like auto-lighting; environmental flooring, and more - contributed to the comfort level of the room - which was fabulous. 2 - The Staff - EVERY SINGLE PERSON that we encountered was helpful, delightful, seemed to love their job, and wanted to make our experience a great one. 3 - The restaurant - we ate there the first night it was open and it was great. Our server was top notch and the food was better than anywhere else in Yountville. 4 - The amentities - you can get spa services in your room, and there is a roof-top hot tub, 75-ft pool; complementary valet, and complementary car service if you need a local ride. Every single person that we encountered at Bardessono was top-notch and we were so relaxed when we left there - we truly did not want to leave!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: AchitaT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a 4 night getaway in January. When we arrived, Katie at the front desk welcomed us and offered a glass of wine. Due it was a last minute decision to go to Napa Valley, we did not make any dinner reservations. The concierge was on her lunch break at that moment, so Katie was kind enough to make us all the reservations. Yountville is a very small town. Great restaurants are all just 2 min walking distance from the hotel. Parking: The parking is free, but you are not allowed to self park. Only valet parking. The valet boys were very courteous and provided an efficient service. I think it helps that they have radio earpiece. Upon our checkout, the valet offered us bottled waters for our way back. Lexus cars: The hotel has 3 Lexus vehicles which you can borrow for 3 hours for free. Room: Our room was on the 2nd floor and our window was looking the town. Very modern. The floor has no carpet, which I loved about it. It feels very clean and spacious. When you go in, the TV is on with a scenic video, like a screen saver. We turned on the gas fireplace and it felt like we were in a spa. When you turn on the TV, it shows the temperature, your name on and other information. It has a little fridge with complimentary water bottles that are re-stocked every day. The bottles are those like the milk glass bottles with a lid. Washroom & closet: It is separated from the room by a sliding door. Very clean and loved the separate vanities. The washroom/walking closet is very spacious due the spa does an in room service with no extra charge. In Room Spa service: We had a in room massage service. Housekeeping comes and sets the massage beds and puts some candles. The spa staff comes in few minutes after and finishes setting up the spa ambiance: dimmers the lights and putting some music. You can do side by side treatment or separate (one in the room and the other in the walking closet/washroom). At the end of the service, the massage therapist sneaks out of the room, sets on: "do not disturb" sign so we can stay lying there until we are ready to get up. Amazing!! Bed Turndown service: house keeping turns on the TV on the nature scene video, dims the lights, leaves the slippers beside the bed and water bottle with a slice of citrus in it. Great service! This hotel is what a 5 star is all about! Thank you Bardessono for making this trip a very, very special one!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to do napa”
Reviews.Author: scubamike51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came here for a three night getaway. The hotel and staff were first class. We had incredible massages and the staff there was the friendliest I have seen. They had just finished renovating the restaurant. The concierge helped plan every meal and winery. I highly recommend the hotel and town. It is central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Flapsdown
Reviews.Content: We first saw the hotel just a few months after it opened 3 years ago, and have been trying to come up with an excuse to stay there. My birthday was the excuse. We just got back from being there and can't wait to return. Yes, it's pricey, but you really do get a special experience. It's done with great attention to detail - all the way to the room lighting controls. The staff is very accommodating and friendly. The rooftop lap pool and hot tob .are designed and integrated into the setting with great taste. Someone spent a great deal of time designing it, and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay”
Reviews.Author: rangers23
Reviews.Content: This was our (traveling with my wife) 3rd stay in 4 years at Bardessono...Another great stay. You really can not beat the location as yountville is a great town to walk. We had a room with a steam shower, a novel idea, but not totally functional as it can take a while to warm up. The service is top notch. I would call in the am to have the car pulled around before we left our room and it would be waiting there. The front desk offer you a glass of wine/water while you do their brief check in process, and you can have them email you your bill vs print it out. We were lucky enough to goto Ad Hoc on a monday when it was chicken night. So good, we have also been to Ad Hoc for brunch, which was great. We had dinner another night at Redd, it was ok, not very napa though, more San Fran/city hip if that is your thing. Dont think you would run into too many locals there. Bouchon bakery in the morning is a must. And coffee from the coffee caboose. Already looking forward to our trip to Napa in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing place, one of the best hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: My 2nd trip to Bardessono was as enjoyable as the first - an exceptionally high level of service, great rooms, great spa. The staff are amazing, know you by name and sight, always helpful in any request, including conjuring up items not on the room service menu when asked to do so. The spa is also great. Within a 3 minute walk of the hotel are some fantastic restaurants to allow you to venture out if you feel the need. Overall an exceptional hotel, and very much worth the price - great value for a very luxurious stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Yountville (and Napa)!”
Reviews.Author: carloalexi
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had been planning for over a year to visit the world-reknown French Laundry restaurant. After numerous failed attempts on http://Opentable.com and conventional phone reservations, we knew that we'd have better luck with a nearby hotel concierge booking it for us... and voilÃ ! It worked! Bardessono was able to score us reservations in less than a month a half... granted we knew we'd have to book a room with them first. Onto the actual hotel review: We visited Bardessono back in June 2011 when we ventured into Yountville, while on a weekend trip in Sonoma. We walked around the grounds, wandered into the lobby and knew we had to stay there one day. We admired the uber-modern architecture, heated pool and its how it maintained a small environmental footprint (LEED Platinum certified). Most importantly, we loved how it was practically in the middle of all Thomas Keller's restaurants (French Laundry, Ad Hoc and Bouchon!). Fast forward to 6 months later (mid-Dec) and we check-in for an overnight stay at their King Spa-Suite. Having brought our two french bulldogs, we called earlier to notify that because the hotel concierge had booked lunch reservations at The French Laundry at 11am that same day and that hotel check-in wasn't until 4pm, we had to make arrangements with the dogs. Front desk happily obliged and had made preparations to have the room ready for the dogs to check-in early. They even offered to walk the dogs while we were out. We only have 30 min to drop off the dogs, get situated in the rooms and change into formal attire for lunch. Walking into our room, I was very impressed with the modern facilities. There was a steam shower, a jacuzzi that fit two people side-by-side, outdoor patio with seating, separate room with a queen sized bed, and so much more! Knowing that we'd bring our dogs, the hotel laid out two dog bowls and plush dog beds. The $125 dog cleaning fee was a little steep but for the quality of the service, it was justifiable. Valet parking (Free!) was mandatory and relatively efficient. After coming back from a 4 hour lunch, we came back to the hotel with two well-behaved (and sleeping dogs). The front desk took them out for a nice stroll so that was a huge bonus. We spent the night relaxing in front of the fireplace. At night, we realized we forgot the boys dog food, so we made a run to the local pet food store. The hotel had a promotion with Lexus that provided a free car rental service to use a 2012 Lexus RX450h. We took that to downtown Napa (15 min. away) and didn't have to pay for gas upon return. Around 10pm, we ordered room service. It had a decent selection (hamburgers, sandwiches, desserts, alcohol, etc.) at typical prices ($16 for hamburger, etc). Delivery was also quick (i.e., took about 20 min max for food to arrive). Overall, we found Bardessono to be a world-class hotel. They were incredibly accommodating! Free internet was a plus! We've stayed at Ritz Carltons, Intercontinental Hotels and The Waldorf=Astoria and we were highly dissapointed that, even while charging $500+/night, wireless internet would still cost $15! Car service with Lexus was also a plus. In the end, we would definitely recommend the hotel for those are willing to pay for top-notch service or for those who want to experience the best in Yountville (who can hook up French Laundry reservations!!). The bill came out to be about $750 for one night. That includes the dog overnight service, 14% tax and $70 of room service. Anytime that we stay in Napa, we'll definitely make Bardessono our #1 choice!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel for relaxing and luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthiaplfung
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, serene and very hospitable. The service is outstanding, the facilities are first class. The spa is absolutely wonderful! A great place to relax and splurge! A great treat and I imagine it could be a romantic gettaway for couples.

Reviews.Title: “...just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: SabinaJCaymanIslands
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night but the entrance to the place was stunning. The check in had a spa like quality, very serene and yet sophisticated. The rooms are amazing and the fireplace kept us nice and warm during our stay as it was very cold. The service is excellent and it is easy to see why this place has such a high Leeds rating. Will go back again.....! Sabina & Jerry

Reviews.Title: “Eco Luxury in Napa”
Reviews.Author: ready4adventure
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at Bardessono for our 2 year wedding anniversary and had an amazing time. Our room was comfortable and modern with electric shades, fireplace and an outdoor sitting area. The breakfast and pool lounge was also amazing! We had spa treatments in our room and the staff lit candles for us. We have stayed at the Harvest inn, Villagio, and Roman hot springs, but none of them compare to our bardessono experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just a perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: shannon n
Reviews.Content: Numerous trips to the wine country have taken us all over but nothing even scratches the surface of this lovely gem tucked away in quiet, charming Yountville. Upon arrival, you are greeted warmly and offered a glass of wine. The front desk staff and concierge make everything flow beautifully. The rooms are phenomenal, appointed in chic comfort right down to the fabulous bath ammenities - In Fiore products! - and gorgeous tub with a few onto our patio. We were warmly welcomed with Belgian chocolates and a delicious bottle of cabernet to celebrate my husband's birthday. It just could not have been more perfect. Make sure you enjoy a nightly sip in the bar. Its warm atmosphere is makes you never want to leave the comfy sofa in front of the fire. A total 5 Star experience, start to finish!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: jettsett97
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival my wife and I were greeted promptly by two staff members, and escorted inside to the lobby. We were given complimentary wine while checking in, which took less than three minutes, then given a tour of the hotel before being shown to our steam spa suite. As we enjoyed the hotel grounds, the staff always greeted us and most of them greeted us by name. The hotel was very relaxing and comfortable, but unfortunately we could not enjoy the pool and cabanas because the temperatures were not favorable. We had breakfast, lunch and dinner at the restaurant and enjoyed each meal, so eating at the hotel is a must. My wife and I were very busy with our different activities and didn't get a chance to enjoy all of the spa amenities the hotel offered, instead we enjoyed the amenities offered in our suite. I suggest starting the steam because it takes about 10 to 15 minutes to get going, while thats producing, draw a bath and use the bath salts in the room, trust me. After the bath has been drawn, enter the steam shower for about twenty minutes or longer if you desire, then immerse yourselves in the bath and turn on the jets and let it run through the cycle. Get back in the shower and use the spa soap provided and I promise you euphoria will follow. Unfortunately the outdoor shower was not an option because it was too cold at night, so to enjoy the patio you will need to visit during warmer months. This hotel is worth the experience, and I think you should pay it a visit.

Reviews.Title: “very stylish”
Reviews.Author: CRR24
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay earlier this week and was extremely impressed with the quality of the rooms and the excellent front of house staff. If you like an uber chic modern hotel this is the place for you! I can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect way to start a honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: cord_thomas
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel with our car full to the windows with all the materials we had been traveling with for our wedding and were eagerly looking forward to a relaxing start to our honeymoon in Napa/Sonoma. We had found Bardessono based on reviews on tripadvisor and elsewhere and from the moment we arrived to the moment we reluctantly left, we were thrilled by the experience. The highlights were definitely the way the staff treated us, the fact that the hotel is platinum LEED certified, the bathtub, and the modern utilities. The staff were all very friendly and eager to please, from our welcome glass of wine and a complimentary champagne (because of our honeymoon) brought to our room, to the explanation of all the features of the room and more, they were wonderful. That this luxury hotel and spa is able to maintain such high environmental standards was also very appealing to us from reclaimed woods and metals to the energy-efficient room features like automatic window shades and lighting. Traveling at the beginning of November is just out of the wine tasting season, so things in general were slow - made the hotel seem a bit of ghost town, which was nice, but an odd sensation as the pool and dinning areas were generally empty. The hotel is on the high-end of our budget, but for a special occasion, it was well worth the money and I would do it again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful 5-Star, Zen-like Property”
Reviews.Author: csg479
Reviews.Content: I can't think of a single thing to say about this place that doesn't include adjectives like superlative. From the physical setting to the rooms to the spectacular bathrooms, this place is divine in every way. We had dinner one night in the restaurant and the food was terrific. Our room was more like an apartment. It had high ceilings and large glass doors to bring the outside in. The balcony was large and private. The materials used throughout were organic and calming-dark woods, brushed metals and lots of glass. Can't say enough about how wonderful it was.

Reviews.Title: “UNREAL! AMAZING! SUPERB SERVICE ALL AROUND”
Reviews.Author: chicagodmb
Reviews.Content: No joke here, this place hands down is one of most amazing places we have ever been to. World travelers here so we have seen a lot. The staff is so helpful, everyone is friendly, nobody is stuck up or has a hidden agenda. Just laid back good people! The rooms are fantastic, no detail left untouched, room service and drinks are exceptional as well. If you go to Napa definately stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent is not nearly strong enough a word...”
Reviews.Author: Andre P
Reviews.Content: Bardessono lives up to everything you might have heard. Worth the price if you are looking to treat yourself. Would definitely want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “High Class-Top notch”
Reviews.Author: ratsuda726
Reviews.Content: hotel was very classy, but wasn't snooty or stuffy at the same time. rooms were very spacious & clean. property was nice. bathrooms in lobby were very fun :)

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Perfection, even in the eyes of a hospitality professional!”
Reviews.Author: OnlineConcierge
Reviews.Content: I thought I would chime in. =) I am tardy on my tripadvisor review, to be sure... it seems that the pervasive calm and ebbing relaxation from my stay has reverberated through me for over a month, and I am pleased to say it was one of the finest night's stays I have had in my life. The people who manage this hotel are true hoteliers, an ever endangered species in this world of budget hotels and the race to the bottom of rate. One of my longtime hospitality marketing friends, back east, makes a joke - "The problem with hospitality nowadays is that there is so little of it." In our current industry, it seems that there are less dyed in the wool hotel operators, and more outsiders or non-hospitality people, running the industry. It's wonderful to be able to stay somewhere run by people who "get" it. Bardessono is for the discerning traveler who wants the best possible experience while traveling. Bardessono has knocked it out of the park. It's a rare experience to see such solid operations and happy, accessible, approachable staff. I think the team on property and Benchmark Hospitality should be very proud of what they have accomplished. It's a rare gem... even more rare because of the Platinum rating. I am involved in three LEED Gold props, and know how difficult it is to design, build, and open a top tier world class luxury resort, without calling attention to the obvious limitations and subtler finishes required by LEED, let alone a Platinum ratings. It's an unbelievable accomplishment, and I doubt we will see too many more of them. It's so subtle, and they made it work to their advantage. The delicate and light use of Eastern influences, coupled with the warm approach to open and flowing interior design, is so inviting, you are almost instinctively led on a property tour simply by how it exists. The Pool Deck is one of the most glamorous I have ever been to, anywhere in the world... it is a place to cherish, and take full advantage of - including your personal cabana boy who can shuttle beverages to and from the barkeep. This is also a dog friendly hotel in a way that no other hotel has ever been... it's amazing, but the dog's can, basically, go anywhere humans can go, without infringing on the other guests. You can dine in the open air patio of the restaurant, so dinner with the pooch is an option as well. From the garden, to the rooms, lobby, bar, and more.... it's a special getaway for the pooch, although the pet fee can run a bit steep. It's probably worth it if you are going to visit for more than a day or two. Finally, their Sunday night special which includes a room and 4 course dinner (with wine pairings in our case), is probably the most incredible deal you will ever find on a romantic night away. It's pretty astonishing... and I suggest you take them up on it before they stop being so generous. =) Hope this review helps you make up your mind! I was *SOOO* skeptical about the value versus the rate. In the end, as a cheap hospitality guy, I would actually have paid more. Value is a nefarious beast.... sometimes you don't know the value you are getting until you experience it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay for a perfect weekend”
Reviews.Author: teruo313
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Napa Valley/Yountville and after looking at a number of reviews we decided to book the Bardessono. From start to finish the staff at the hotel did a excellent job to make our stay a relaxing one for our anniversary. They were kind enough to leave champagne and chocolate treats on our first night there which is always a welcomed touch. The rooms are very spacious, modern and most importantly clean! While in your room you really do get the feel of being away from it all as not once did I hear noise from the outside or surrounding rooms. Also the layout of the rooms especially with the fireplace really does give a romantic feel. The service was great as we often went down to bother to hotel staff on recommendations from restaurants in the area to short driving locations and we were not disappointed with any of their suggestions. One experience to note is that every morning I woke up early to go for a quick jog around, after I finished I grabbed a paper and went into the restaurant where to grab a coffee as I waited for my wife to wake up. Not once was I ever charged for my morning coffee which I thought was really nice of them to do. The hotel itself was in a great location where it was only a couple minute walk to a number of great restaurants and shops. My wife enjoyed the spa treatments that they offered while I enjoyed the outdoor pool. However there always has to be atleast one negative for every review in order to remain objective. In the case of the Bardessono it would have to be the price. Understand that I am in no way complaining about the price, just a note of caution to those looking to potentially book that a great experience like this doesn't come cheap. However in my opinion it's certainly worth it to treat yourself once in a while.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Retreat in the Middle of it All”
Reviews.Author: Jeff R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I "accidentally" stumbled upon this jewel of a resort on a quick trip to the valley and had one of the more enjoyable stays we can remember. You know when a place has "it" and you realize how rare that is. Bardessono has it! Rooms: The rooms are spacious, modern, clean and highly functional. While modern is not my preferred architectural style the rooms here pull it off very well. The bathrooms are HUGE and well designed and the bedrooms are large and comfortable. Our room had a sofa (which was a day-bed if you needed it), a fireplace, a large flat-screen television and an incredibly comfortable bed. The room also had a huge deck with two sitting areas. Service: The folks who work here must really like their jobs because you can't fake the authentic, friendly service this hotel offered. From the front desk to the bar (my wife and I agree that Sara is possibly the best bartender in the state) to the spa the staff here is top-notch. This staff rates with Mandarin Las Vegas and Four Seasons Punta Mita as the best service staff I have ever encountered at a hotel. They are young, friendly, professional and eager to please. Kudos to the management for both selection and training! Location: As the title says this place is literally in the middle of Yountville, but feels secluded and private. About as perfect as a location can be. One is a three minute walk to the heart of Yountville, which is a perfect base for a trip to the valley. Simply put the location is perfect! Physical facility: The designers of this place got it all right. The facility is highly functional and beautiful! The pool is on top of the spa building (which is very cool) and the bar looks out over the grounds and a cool little pool/pond. The spa was nice (the only draw-back was the size of the men's locker room. . .about big enough for two people to share) and the massage I got was very good. Restaurant/Bar: In Yountville there are some of the best restaurants in the state. Given that fact this restaurant has a bit further to go. We had dinner here Sunday night and it was very good, just not great. It will need to be great to compete. The bar, however, was great! Good wine list (not great. . .especially for Napa) accompanied by excellent bartenders and friendly guests makes for a fantastic place to grab a pre-dinner cocktail! Value: As one might expect this is an expensive hotel. We felt the value was there based on the quality of the experience. At this price point things need to be nearly perfect. . .and they were. Overall: If you are coming to Napa for a couple of days and want an incredible experience with a convenient location then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Last Nights Stay”
Reviews.Author: NGER14
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 3 couples travelling across California on Harley-Davidsons. This was to be our last nights stop prior to flying home from San Francisco. Arrived mid afternoon in the baking October heat. Checked in to our fabulous rooms and then hit the room top pool/jacuzzi. Would loved to have stayed another night as we all felt we could have really enjoyed it more. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, snobby Service”
Reviews.Author: thebiz2011
Reviews.Content: We were married in Napa and love going back and were excited to try this hotel. We went with a group and were appalled at how we were treated. At first it was the bar manager with a snobby, pompous attitude; then the Director of Sales and Marketing (who sold our group on having our event there) had too much to drink and actually got into a bar fight in the hotel bar. It was the worst service I have EVER seen, and I've seen a lot of service! Pretty hotel, lots of potential, but not until they get their staff focused on being polite to their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Bardessono”
Reviews.Author: guess2
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at Bardessono during a week long tour of the northern coast and wine country. Our room was very nice--particularly the courtyard area and the enormous spa bathroom and soaking tub. For our anniversary, they surprised us with a nice bucket of champagne and confections. The grounds were beautiful. I note that some of the other reviews criticize the hotel's design and decor. I don't think the hotel can be rated poorly on that. While the modern decor is not our cup of tea either, everything was done very well and was immaculately clean. We walked to dinner at Bottega and to the Bouchon Bakery in the morning. Also enjoyed the complimentary coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel & Service for our Group”
Reviews.Author: keithnewhook
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 16 from Canada going down for my wedding in Napa. myself and my wife had stayed at Bardessono 4-5 times before on vacation and fell in love with the rooms, lounge, restaurant, and unparalleled service we receive each stay. The rooms are incredible, high end finishes and attention to all the details. To say they go above and beyond is an understatement. My wife called down one evening for a small room service order and 10 minutes later a hotel staffer showed up with water, tea and lemon because he "noticed it sounded like she had a sore throat on the phone". within a day of staying with them, the staff know your name, they know your preferences for drinks, etc. They let several couples in our group borrow the Lexus vehicles they have for short trips to shopping, lunch, hot air balloon tours, etc. The lounge staff are outstanding as well, not just regular bar staff, but friendly and very knowledgeable at mixing their own recipes with the freshest ingredients (try their Bloody Mary!). We would certainly vote this hotel the top in the Valley, and among one of the top we've ever stayed at in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Yet to find its feet”
Reviews.Author: Style T
Reviews.Content: We wanted a Napa holiday in a small quaint town, and Yountville came up tops on that. We zeroed in on Bardessono based on the reivews at tripadvisor (i am a great fan of this site!), so we werent expecting the perfect hotel. The minimalist architecture and use of water and the landscaping is very soothing. The rooms are well appointed, the natural light and the outdoor bath are perfect to enjoy the summers in Napa. They have the best massuer, who can do the massage in your own room! The place has a youthful feel to it. However the service needs a lot of attention. There is no continuity with shift change, Katie at the front desk was the best and other staff sure have a few things to learn from her. Concierge was very average and wasnt much help in suggesting wineries or activities. Also very poor at suggesting restaurants for dinner (please book in advance this little town has some great places to eat which are booked several days in advance!). The F&B manager is a very sweet guy trying to get everyone up on the service quality. The best part was the sophisticated WC in the common areas, wonder why they wouldnt have the same in the rooms :-). Overall not worth the premium.

Reviews.Title: “A truly memorable and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Lauren H
Reviews.Content: Napa Valley has just gotten infinitely better with Bardessono in the charming little town of Yountville. The property is an elegant oasis, LEED platinum and with all the finest amenities of a luxury resort without the pretentiousness or stuffiness. The grounds are stunning and location is perfect. We were greeted with a warm welcome from every staff member we came in contact with. My hubby and I spent the weekend there to celebrate our wedding anniversary and now we want to make it an annual trip. I can't remember feeling so sad to leave a place before! At check in , you are offered a lovely glass of wine and escorted to your room by a friendly person who takes the time to inform you of the layout of the grounds and all the activities offered at the property. It is so refreshing to find a very dog friendly property as well. They love dogs and welcome them throughout many areas on the property. They even made a special welcome letter and amenity for our pup ! The rooftop pool is NOT to be missed. It was truly heavenly to float around looking out into the beautiful napa hills and countryside. They also have dreamy cabanas (try not to nap in one of these after a delicious mojito) and a small bar serving drinks and small bites for your pleasure. For the foodies, you will be amazed by the Chef's garden you can walk through and then enjoy the excellent, local, organic food offered at the restaurant. We had a great dinner in the courtyard one evening beside the beautiful fountain overlooking the stars. At breakfast, we had the best croque madame i have ever had, <and i lived in Paris!> I can't say enough good things about this place, i am jealous of anyone who is there at this moment!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this jewel of Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: WA T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our 28th anniversary weekend in Napa, Ca. From the moment we turned in the driveway we were overwhelmed. First by the beautiful landscaping. Then by the amazing staff. We were swept away into the most relaxing surrounds as they took our car to their private parking lot. All included. Our registration process quick and pleasant before Armando lead us to our room. Besides quiet falls and gardens full of art work we worked our way to our room. It was by far the nicest suite of our lives. Beyond the 7 star experiences weve enjoyed. Vince, Brett and the staff provides refreshing beverages and great dining with all local fresh organic ingredients. And right in the middle of the downtown Yountville. The personal attention and amenities were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Zen like oasis in wine country”
Reviews.Author: travel58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bardessano for two nights and wished we had more time. From the moment you enter and are greeted with a glass of wine, to the moment you leave you are made to feel welcome, pampered and relaxed. The rooms are modern yet romantic with shades that open as you enter, an in wall gas fireplace, large dressing/bath area, and private patios. The pool and lounge and dining room are soothing and beautiful. It is conveniently located within walking distance of great restaurants, inns and wine tasting rooms, as well as an easy drive to all the vineyards. They have bikes and helmets available at no extra charge and even fill water bottles for you. The staff is attentive and professional. Make sure to check out the hi-tech toilets by the lounge!

Reviews.Title: “ideal location and amenities, but not sure if worth the price”
Reviews.Author: mini_tako
Reviews.Content: the Bardessono was obviously a nice hotel with nice amenities. the location was great, walking distance to great restaurants and wineries. beautiful scenery. just what you want when staying in Napa Valley. the room was very spacious which was a huge plus and the bathroom was perfect (my kind of bathroom!). it was great to have a private patio to eat al fresco every morning. so like every other reviewer, it was a great overall experience and place to stay. the price was ok... we've stayed in a lot of nice places and the price always felt or seemed to match what you were getting. i do think the price here is a bit high, but i get it- the location and the fact that its Yountville keeps prices/rates competitive. i would say great place for a special occasion, although i wish it was more affordable for anyone who just wanted a relaxing weekend away in Napa. highly recommended for those who want to feel a bit more privacy during their hotel stays.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Enjoys_Relaxing
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Downtown Yountville location, and ever so close to the wineries. The rooms are big, the jacuzzi tub is extremely fun. But I think the service is what makes this place so memorable. From the valet, to the front desk, even the restaurant staff; everybody is so friendly. The pool, however, is rather small, and on a Sunday afternoon, it was fully packed. Even though I enjoyed dinner at the hotel restaurant, the variety of restaurants and the high quality of food served within Yountville makes a weekend stay a must.

Reviews.Title: “CLOUD 9... pure bliss”
Reviews.Author: FrecklesParis
Reviews.Content: I was on Cloud 9 during my entire stay! The room was a cocoon of comfort and tranquility: I loved the patio, the curtain separating the second room from the main room, the relaxing clips on the TV (waterfalls, fireworks, plants), the bottled water and tea in the fridge, the muted browns and clay colors... We went cycling every morning then spent our afternoons by the pool in a bubble of bliss, enjoying the relaxing lounge music and Eddie's incomparable poolside service. The bigeye tuna sandwich and the beet salad were to die for. In fact, I hope heaven is just like Bardessono. Thank you to the entire staff for an unforgettable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Paradise at Steep Price Tag”
Reviews.Author: alegria310
Reviews.Content: Location! Location! Location! You can't get better than the Bardessono. It is within walking distance of some of the best eateries at Yountville. Everything is a close car or bike ride away. The spa suite is nice, but definitely not worth the price tag. My friend and I got a great deal and we decided to splurge. Otherwise it's not worth what you get in return. The comforters on the beds are just heavenly. However, the beds are very firm. If you like pillowtop mattresses, this isn't going to be the right place for you. The blinds are a nice touch, but they get annoying early in the morning. My friend went out for a jog and when she came back the blinds automatically go up and woke me up. The double tub is really nice and the shower is great too! There are in room massage tables should you fancy a nice spa treatment. Staying on the first floor when there is another suite above you is horrible. You can hear every footstep and every stumble up and down the stairs. I can't call it true R&R unless I can get a full night sleep. The grounds and decor of this resort is amazing! Everywhere we went make a great backdrop for photos! It's definitely beautiful! We adored the cabanas at the pool. If you get tired of going to wineries, spend some time at a cabana and pamper yourself. You can order food or drinks there and they have all the things you need to have a good time: beach balls, water loungers to sit in the pool, and sun block. The pool staff are very courteous and stop by every 30 minutes to ask if you need a refill or more water. They also can help hold your cabana for you if you promise to return quickly. The restaurant at the resort is actually great for breakfast and lunch! We really enjoyed our meals there and it didn't cost an arm and a leg like the rest of the resort. We took a Lexus SUV hybrid out. There are 2 of them available for 3 hour blocks. The resort also offers Lexus car service for anywhere in Yountville. I got really annoyed that on the way to dinner, the concierge couldn't make that car service available on a saturday night. She said that there's only 1 valet. Usualy there are 3-4 valets any given time. How can they possibly have just 1 on the busiest night of the week? On the way home, I called the front desk and of course they made the ride happen. I probably would just bypass the snooty concierge lady next time.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Girls' Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Tina Q
Reviews.Content: You will sooooo not be disappointed by this resort. They knew who I was when I walked up to the reception desk, offered us a glass of wine, and gave us a great tour of the property. The concierges are very knowledgable of the area and know all the little secret places to tour and dine. The location is PERFECT. Right across the street from the best dining in Yountville. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Might be the nicest place we've ever stayed...”
