Reviews.Author: LittleLongBeach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I picked the Bardessono to celebrate our anniversary in. Aside from its Platinum LEED certification, we decided on this property because of its clean, modern design. Its a bit different than the standard French or Tuscan designs of similarly rated resorts in the area. Upon arrival we were upgraded to one of their Tufa suites - concrete/tile floor living room with a gas fireplace through to the king sized bedroom, an amazing bathroom with a champagne jacuzzi tub and steam shower that had an entrance to an outdoor shower and a great patio with deck chairs and a small bistro table. The electronic shades (controllable from inside) were just too cool. The fireplace took the chill out of the air each morning and made for some cozy evenings. We enjoyed room service breakfast each morning and fell in love with their coffee! The roof top pool was a quiet and comfortable place to relax with some mid afternoon snacks and beverages. We opted for their in-suite couples massage and were completely impressed. The staff were phenomenal - professional and accommodating. We were greeted several times by staff that not only knew our names, but that wished us a happy anniversary each time they saw us. The location of the property is excellent as well - literally walking distance to all of the haute cuisine Yountville has to offer and only minutes from the highway for quick drives to downtown Napa. We walked to the Maisonry tasting room and spent hours in the art gallery sampling some of their wines from 16 different vintners. Bardessono's prices are a bit steep but after a 5 day stint, sparing nothing and just letting ourselves be pampered and loved - we do not regret spending a penny. We loved it and are already looking for another excuse to return.

Reviews.Title: “"OMG"”
Reviews.Author: travelbug215
Reviews.Content: This beautiful state-of-the-art hotel was absolutely amazing!! It was my mother's birthday and they placed a beautiful tray of truffles by her bedside. The jacuzzi bathtub was incredible, especially when the special mechanism dried the left over water after the tub was drained. The bed was comfortable. The beautiful patio with the lounge chairs added to our stay. You must visit the rooftop pool. Everyone was extremely helpful and delicious eating establishments everywhere. I would definitely come back to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning â€“ Best Bathroom of the Year Award”
Reviews.Author: Fleetcat
Reviews.Content: We took a one bedroom suite with an outside patio. Brilliant layout with separate bed and living areas, a gorgeous patio with beautiful flowers and a bathroom that I would happily move to my home â€“ inside and outside showers, huge dual sinks, jacuzzi bath, separate loo and massive wardrobe space! Tiny critique is that the sunbathing area was overlooked by next door upstairs balcony but that is splitting hairs. We did not eat dinner here but the restaurant was very prettily done and the menu looked amazing. When we return (as we shall) we will definitely book a meal here. The rooftop pool was a super space with a delightful bar and lots of shade either in the seating area or in the wonderful (for two) day beds. The entire hotel is manicured to within an inch of its life. Iâ€™m guessing they have a squad entirely devoted to dead-heading the bedding plants and trimming the grass with nail scissors! Only thing that wasnâ€™t great was breakfast in the room. A poor girl came with a tray laden with cast iron holders that must have been incredibly heavy â€“ presumably supplied to keep our eggs and bacon hot â€“ and they were still cold! Next time weâ€™ll have breakfast in the lovely restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place We've Ever Stayed!”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four days here during our daughter's Napa wedding. It is a beautiful facility and the people are the friendliest we've ever met. We were offered a glass of wine at the front desk and escorted to our room. All members of the staff were extremely friendly and always concerned about making our stay a pleasurable one. The rooms are fantastic and elegant. Everything has been thought out to make your stay enjoyable and comfortable. I know we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: HUH42
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my short stay in this hotel. The rooms are very high teck and the outdoor shower was very cool. The breakfast was out of the ordinary. The hotel is not cheap but it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: humbug31
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, great hotel. Rooms are great, large and bathrooms are really nice and big. Lovely deck off our room, could have taken better care of the plants on the deck. Pool area was very nice, nice touch the cabanas around the pool. Very modern decor. Great out door sitting area off the reception area, very nice for a drink. Very central in yountville, waking distance to all the restaurants . Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “High Style and prices to match”
Reviews.Author: patriotic
Reviews.Content: First, I want to say that we visited the property soon after it opened. The place is immaculate. The rooms are amazing and spacious, although VERY pricey. They are decorated in a minimalist sort of style. It really feels like you have your own little house. It's the little things that are so nice here; electric shades, steam shower, outdoor shower, large living area, flat screens. You wind up not wanting to leave the room!! We also ate breakfast at the hotel and it too, was really good. Again, the little touches made the difference. If there's anything negative to say, I can only offer my opinion here: At times, the staff sometimes seems a little pretentious. If money is no object we would return again and again. For the charm of the place, the amazing breakfast and spa, I think the better value is at Villagio, which is across the street. I feel it better captures the allure and feel of the wine country. If you are looking for a more reclusive and high-style accommodation, then this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “napa valley perfection”
Reviews.Author: lstrand
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about Bardessono. The property itself is simple and elegant featuring indigenous landscaping, and minimalist elegant architecture. The rooms are large, light, airy. Super friendly, helpful staff. Comfortable beds, a very cool wall system mounted outside the window wall that raises and lowers to create an open, louvered, or darkened interior. Huge tiled bathrooms, luxury bath and shower. Only little complaint is the sitting area has a fairly uncomfortable straight back built-in banquette-style settee (a normal comfy couch would be nice). Large outdoor private seating areas for each room. Best of all, you can stay here and never drive your car since for wine tasting or other local touring they will loan you a complimentary bicycle, and within 5 walking minutes you can dine at Bouchon, Bottega, Ad Hoc, Redd, Bistro Jeanty, or even The French Laundry. Pretty much my idea of a perfect weekend, or longer retreat. Oh, forgot the spa!

Reviews.Title: “Blissful”
Reviews.Author: SnapperJam
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at Bardessono where I enjoyed both the property and the most excellent staff. The property is lovely and has an intimate feel to it. The amenities are great with a beautiful roof deck pool, and bikes that one can use to cycle around the area. However, I was most impressed by the staff at the hotel who went out of their way to provide us with service par excellence. The hotel is well situated allowing for one to stroll about the town to restaurants and wine tasting easily. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: travelebefuninthesun
Reviews.Content: I chose this place because I had planned to propose to my girlfriend and wanted the weekend to be extra special. From the time we pulled up to the Valet to the time we left we experienced nothing but the best customer service and the staff at Bardessono made our stay better than I could have ever imagined. About a month before I contacted the hotel and Hillary (the concierge) went out of her way to suggest possible wineries and locations to pop the question. I called her so many times that by the end she recognized my number when I called but she was always so friendly and excited to help make this special weekend perfect. While on the property we dined at the restaurant for both dinner and breakfast and the food was excellent. The drinks were also great. The room we had was amazing with an outside shower on our private patio and the inside room was spacious, well decorated, and very comfortable. Look at photos online to see if you like the style and look of the hotel because it is different than any others and I mean that in a good way. If you do not mind spending the money to stay at this place, the staff is second to none and everyone working there goes out of their way to accommodate you and make sure your stay is amazing. Also, it is right in the heart of Yountville so you can walk to many nice restaurants and the Hill family wine tasting room which is a must. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for enjoying wine country”
Reviews.Author: LilyATL
Reviews.Content: This is a LEED rated resort and in a perfect location to enjoy the wineries and best food in the area - walked distance to Bottega and Ad Hoc! We loved it. The rooms are beautifully appointed and each has a balcony. It's not inexpensive though - no bargains but if you are looking for a really nice location and beautiful room, Bardessono is great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Bardessono! Looking forward to our return!”
Reviews.Author: Toscana3
Reviews.Content: Traveled here with my Mother and Sister on our yearly girls' getaway. This was an excellent hotel. Beautiful rooms, great service, and unique property. The location is within easy walking distance of the best restaurants in Yountville!! The weather was cold and rainy, but the fireplaces in the rooms and throughout the property make it cozy. Very expensive, but worth it!! We really hope to be able to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was amazing. Walking in, the service, the flow and the beauty of the space = RELAX.”
Reviews.Author: boixo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful! I think they had the space planned with a feng shui expert as I never completely decompress and here we did. The service was great and my husband can't stop raving about the fact that they had delicious, FREE bottled water in the room :) We were thrilled!

Reviews.Title: “Can 3 nights ever be worth a mortgage payment?”
Reviews.Author: co2il
Reviews.Content: This place came really close to the above question. Great, top notch staff. All very friendly and helpful. When I posted pictures my friends thought we rented a house. It has everything but a kitchen, so pretty close. The whole property is beautiful and has the best pool/terrace area I have ever seen. A couple things besides the price that kept this from getting 5 stars. - The phone calls to the front desk and spa were not answered more than they were. - The ac unit is loud when it clicks on and off and is harder to set and change than needs to be. - There is very little sound deadening from the outside. The area is very quieit, so not a huge issue, but we did hear maids and maintance crews outside a couple mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Stay in the Heart of the Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: eshopgirl
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Bardessono Hotel and Spa was simply wonderful! Beautiful architecture (LEED certified too), superb valet guys whom are always courteous and friendly, great room suite designs where you can get in-room spa treatments, best location in the wine country (less than 8-10 miles to majority of the places we visited which included Domaine Carneros, Morimoto in downtown Napa, Quintessa, etc) closer to the wineries we love (eg Cakebread, Jarvis, Opus One, Robert Mondavi, etc). The cost of the hotel per night is a bit high but we had wanted a hotel or rather a stay that wasnt a typical bed and breakfast country style inn... with a bit of a modern touch. This hotel, despite the price factor, would make you feel restored and pampered. We would recommend this hotel to others - no doubt about it!

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: FromthebootPA
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in the Napa Valley and we are glad that we heeded the the outstanding reviews from Trip Advisor. The concierge was very helpful in assisting us with planning our trip in regards to tours, restaurant recommendations, and spa services. The rooms were spacious. My wife loved the outdoor patio area where we ate breakfast every morning. Great location to all the restaurants in Yountville. We also ate at the hotel restaurant one night and the meal, service, and atmospher were exceptional. If you have the chance you should spend some time at the pool which has plenty of seating and spectacular views. We definately plan to return to the Bardessano our next time in Napa. Truly a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A Napa Paradise”
Reviews.Author: LGCbus
Reviews.Content: Bardessono is a Napa gem. Tucked into the modest looking town of Yountville, this hotel exceeded our expectations as a quiet and relaxing resort. We were greeted immediately by friendly and attentive staff, eager to make our stay stress free and relaxing. From the wine offering at the front desk, to the personal tour of our room and amenities, we felt well taken care of immediately. The room was fantastic, equipped with state of the art shades and my favorite - a his/hers closet and sink space! My favorite part of the property was my walk to my room each morning and night, with gorgeous gardening and waterfalls. The pool was also really nice, set on the 2nd floor with a panoramic view of the mountains and friendly staff eager to cater to our every need. We did not make reservations at the restaurant, but will likely next time we return, but I can say the bartender made me the BEST cappuccino I've ever had in the lounge. (I drink a lot of cappuccino!) Overall, the place exceeding our expectations and we WILL return. It was quiet and beautiful, I cannot wait to return! P.S. You get free bike rentals with your stay, and they even equip your borrowed bike with a bottle of ice water before you leave!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic setting and luxurious accomodations”
Reviews.Author: 1401travelers
Reviews.Content: We looked for a relaxing spa-like setting to spend our time in Napa. We were blown away at the location and the service. The suites are beautiful and spacious. We simply did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Napa Retreat”
Reviews.Author: kalipal17
Reviews.Content: Bardessono is hands down one of the most beautiful and innovative resorts I have ever visited. The staff is friendly and fun, the rooms are amazing, the grounds are immaculate. Loved this place! We cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved Bardessono, and cannot wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: skolair4
Reviews.Content: The rooms, grounds, rest.,, bar, spa were all excellent, but what makes this hotel so special is the staff.....There is nothing they won't do for you to make your stay special. From getting us coffee at 4:45 am before our balloon trip, to getting items from our car, bringing plates and silverware to our room within seconds for us to use for cheese and crackers we brought back to our room with us. I will never stay anywhere else when I go to Napa and Sonoma. They were nothing short of superb.

Reviews.Title: “A splurge, short of perfection”
Reviews.Author: finickytripper
Reviews.Content: SUMMARY The Bardessono is no doubt an exceptional experience, from the environmental stewardship it promotes to the daring architecture, its location at the fine-dining epicenter of Napa Valley, its customer service, and the extravagance of its rooms. As evidenced by several positive reviews, many - especially those with carefree money to spend - will undoubtedly have a wonderful experience at this property, and my new bride and I had a good one. But the experience could have been better, and for the price, it should have been much better. My wife and I don't splurge like this too often, but when we do, we expect the best and usually get it. I've tried to highlight both the good and not-so-good below: SLEEP QUALITY Liked: Bed was clean and comfortable. Outside traffic noises and those between rooms seemed minimal. Easy to set a wake-up call on the slick IP phones. Didn't like: We slept poorly here. Some part of the bedding material made a notable amount sound when moved, which we both found odd and distracting. We were awoken multiple times by the sound of running water, possibly from a leak in the toilet bowl or tub faucet? The room blinds have a gap that allows a fair amount of light in after sunrise. The AC seemed to make no sound whatsoever, so those accustomed to sleeping with white noise will need another source. Occasionally heard high heels on concrete outside walkways. LOCATION Liked: Easy walking distance to great restaurants, such as Bottega, Hurley's, Bistro Jeanty and Thomas Keller's places. Easy drive to Brix, Mustard's, and plenty of wineries. Away from the main roads, reducing traffic noise. Didn't like: The in-town placement doesn't lend itself to a complete wine country getaway. During our visit, a B&B across the street was doing a noisy remodel during the day, and a neighboring property did some brief jackhammering (neither the fault of the Bardessono). Some views are of streets and/or parking lots. PROPERTY Liked: The contemporary architecture distinguishes it from many other lodgings in the area. The common areas were very clean. Open-air spaces brought in sunshine and fresh air, while retained original trees, water features, and plenty of new landscaping softened the edges of the bold design. Spacious vehicle entryway and valet area for a no-fuss loading and unloading (appreciated in California). Absolutely, positively don't miss the full-service toilets in the area near the bar... Didn't like: Some of the spaces felt cold and unfriendly due to the bold lines/materials and in some cases, lack of shade. They've made the design decision to allow the natural woods to fade and the metals to rust; interesting, but not necessarily attractive. Art appreciation is of course quite subjective, but we simply found the wall art unattractive. Some paths to common areas led past the welcome area, valets, dining room hostess, or other personnel, leading me to occasionally wish for a little more freedom to move about without being greeted constantly. Gardening maintenance in some areas appeared to be lacking, with weed growth or lack of crispness; the property garden was unattractive during my visit. A space behind the dining room that was suggested for our wedding gathering had flypaper dangling nearby... ROOM Liked: The huge bathroom was amazing, from the jacuzzi tub, to the steam shower, the large wardrobe, separate sink areas, good lighting, access to the outdoor shower, etc. The suite was very spacious, and the fireplace area was very attractive. All the technology was very nice, although we did find ourselves fussing over some of the features occasionally. The large patio area was like being at home. Didn't like: Unattractive, cheap-looking rug and dark-teal sofa. Cold florescent lighting on stark white walls. Power blinds were cool at first, then a bit annoying in their fussiness. With hard floors throughout, sounds carry easily. Bathroom door didn't seem to close properly. Outside entry to room featured unhidden ugly pipes, fire extinguisher, and/or other infrastructure. Despite assurances that neighbors couldn't see the outdoor shower area, we had line of sight to a neighboring balcony; staff assured us they would move anyone in that room to avoid privacy issues. SERVICE Liked: We were greeted by name when we first arrived, and many of the staff remembered our names throughout our stay. We were married during our visit, and many took the time to congratulate us, comment nicely, etc. The time between calling the concierge and help of any kind appearing at the door could often be measured in seconds, literally. Whether it was gardening of our patio, set-up of glassware for an in-suite gathering, or extra housekeeping requests, personnel were prompt, friendly and skilled. Communication and coordination among staff was great; a request to the overnight personnel had good follow-through the next day. The pool service was great and friendly; I could get used to someone handing me Champagne while I float in the pool! Didn't like: We'd very well socialized in advance that we were going to be married on our suite patio, but upon arrival, the gardening of that area was sorely lacking. The plants were very overgrown, and one weed grew as high as my head! By phone, the concierge desk leaned too far toward cool and professional for my taste; I prefer a little more warmth. The desk was also a bit awkward in person. Each time we went by the area, two staff members were busily typing and answering calls; walk-ups didn't seem welcome, no greetings were given and our hellos were missed/ignored. We were told that coffee was complimentary at the bar each morning, but after making us an espresso, the bartender told us she'd comp us for our wedding day; we have to assume espressos aren't free, or we missed the cutoff time. SPA Liked: Having a very relaxing couples massage in our own suite, with blinds closed, fireplace going, soothing music. Very sweet, skilled masseuses. Friendly explanations by phone of the spa offerings. Didn't like: Although skeptical of the package, we paid extra to have a bath drawn for after the massage. One masseuse had to keep going to fuss with the tub to draw the bath, which was a bit distracting and reduced the time of the massage itself. We went straight to the tub after the massages, and found that the water was cold, and had to re-draw the bath ourselves. We paid for a spa pkg deal, but found it impossible to use our full credit without paying even more out of pocket, due to significant inflexibility in the spa's rules. We ended up leaving the credit unspent instead, which was frustrating. POOL Liked: Views of the surrounding valley from both ends of the pool. Free cabanas and pool floats. During our visits, it was kid-free and quiet, with a Euro-chic feel. Pool staff were very attentive. Didn't like: The pool staff requested $20 corkage to bring wine to the pool area. Bees and other debris were sometimes floating in the pool. One small jacuzzi seems a bit lacking. FOOD Liked: After hours, the restaurant went above and beyond to allow me to order from the full menu, and we had one of the best fish dishes I've had in my life. Swordfish sandwiches by the pool were good. Great breads, including one from Bouchon Bakery. Some items were served on sustainably harvested materials, and the staff was trained to explain it. Didn't like: Some portions were small for the prices. Room service has the usual delivery charges on top of the included gratuity. MANAGEMENT Liked: A manager gave me his complete, undivided attention to listen to some of my concerns about the stay. He seemed genuinely sorry for the less-than-perfect experience, and interested in improving. Some credit was applied to help compensate; if not for this, I would have rated the property/experience lower. The manager also engaged the general manager, who later approached me to apologize, and warmly encouraged an ongoing relationship with the property. Didn't like: The partial credit for our stay was mishandled upon checkout, leading to some awkwardness in bringing this to management's attention, then waiting for an extended period for it to be corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, but so so concierge”
Reviews.Author: NewbieTubes
Reviews.Content: Bardessono is a romantic get-away for couples. Pro: Ground beautiful, green. Room large, bathtub romantic, restaurant served one of the most delicious meals I've eaten in California AND they can bring it to your private terrace, spa immaculate, in-room couples massage amazing Cons: Concierge put us on waitlist for French Laundry's Lunch service during the week, when FL doesn't serve lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: Suz259
Reviews.Content: I normally write wordy reviews...but just know that this place it top notch...no words needed! Friendly and helpful concieger/check-in and valet staff. Gorgeous spa like grounds. The rooms are simple in decor but amazing in amenities (such as the spa shower and outdoor shower) as well as the green amenitites and technologies incorporated. The roof top pool is a wonderful sanctuary. We enjoyed breakfast in the room on our patio, took a bike ride (using the hotels bikes) up to Oakville which is about 6 miles roundtrip and a beautiful experience. Also, take advantage of test driving the Lexus hybrid if you can. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - perfect for French Laundry outings”
Reviews.Author: oscarfelix
Reviews.Content: The hotel, as many have said, is visually stunning. If you like modern design you'll love this - we are not frilly b & b people. Even though it's in town (though Yountville isn't much of a town) you feel immediately secluded in their beautiful zen courtyards. The rooms are very large and the bathrooms are huge. We loved the steamshower and the bath products were also very good. Another nice touch was the minibar filled with glass water bottles of the water the hotel filters. I hate throwing away a ton of empty bottles when I'm traveling. The breakfast here is excellent and we really enjoyed eating in their courtyard. The reason we stayed here, though, is the proximity to the French Laundry which was the reason for the trip. It's a five minute walk to FL and a five minute walk to a number of other amazing restaurants like Bottega which we loved. It's also a great base for driving around Napa valley. The other place we looked at staying was Calistoga Ranch which looked amazing, but we decided it was just too far from things for a quick weekend trip and we'd have to get a car service for French Laundry.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better...”
Reviews.Author: B-cube
Reviews.Content: One of those "green" hotels with a modern, supposedly first class (no need to explain in what terms this is meant to be) objective, but only till that. Why? As a first time guests to the property, choosing it over the Napa Valley Lodge which we stayed in rather disappointingly last year, we were expecting something better. Yes, we were offered our choice of a welcome drink, but was not shown around the property's facilities. The Ritz and Aman showed us around and told us where we can go and spend our time apart from wine tasting. Yes, we were offered complimentary bottles of water to drink, but was offered a pathetic packet of roasted almonds as a welcome treat. Yes, we had a room so spacious, but the pillow choices gave me and my husband some uncomfortable sleepless nights. Yes, the garden was beautiful, but the facilities, like the lazy hammock, were not even clean---could have used one lazy afternoon after a steak of wine-tasting to doze off or read a book. Yes, the modern restaurant is inviting, but did not have an atmosphere like Redd. C'mon, my husband and I would at least have some complimentary coffee in the mornings. Napa Valley Lodge at least offers comps for breakfast. Yes, the bathroom had the built-in steam room mechanism embedded in the separate shower, but it is a steam room adrift off the pipes where the steam supposedly comes from. Yes, the shower room is separate from the superb tub, but the shower hub would have been better off as a rainshower model. Even H2 Hotel in Healdsburg, another "green" hotel has got an excellent rainshower. Yes, the room is like one taken off a Bond novel, but there should have been a remote to control all the fixtures while I and my husband dream off----you know, where we do not have to get off the bed to turn off the fireplace, or the bedroom lights, etcetera. Great shop as well. But the only time we chose to come in, the shop attendant was busy at the phone conversing with another Gossip Girl. And we understand Bardessono even gives Hill Family Estate Winery the privilege to use the property for their wine launch parties, so why can't guests like us have some complimentatry bottles (or bottle) of their fine wines on the first night stay? And as we drive off to our other destinations, we were not even offered bottles of water to drink to quench us off during our long drive----the Ritz (whether it be Wolfsburg or Berlin or SFO), Bernardus of Carmel, Amangiri of Utah does it----why can't Bardessono? Eanie-meanie-minie-mo, we'll toss a coin where to stay next time in Napa.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful design”
Reviews.Author: PandM0
Reviews.Content: A stunning design for the architecture and grounds. It's well located to things in Yountville, and as such is not in a peaceful, quiet environment like others such as the Auberge. Although we experienced poor service in the restaurant, the GM was amazing in his follow-up to my complaints. Redd, a great restaurant a couple of blocks away, was excellent. Rooms are spacious, well laid out, but lighting could be better over the sofa--a minor complaint. We liked the large deck with umbrella, but the view of the adjacent parking lot left much to be desired--so you might ask for a room with a better view, or ground floor suite. Great ipod hook-up. The complimentary yoga class on Saturday was awesome. I expected a better spa experience (had a facial), but it's small and therefore limited to how plush the waiting room is. The Round Pond Estate winery was amazing, and was recommended by the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: love2travel79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to celebrate our 10th year anniversary in Napa Valley. We decided on Bardessono because of its modern style and great reviews. The modern dÃ©cor in the common and outdoor areas were perfect. The hotel has a luxurious and relaxing feel. However, the rooms should have had a warmer feel to them, instead they are stark. The room was large with a nice outdoor sitting area. The bathroom was to die for, large soaking tub, outdoor shower, his and her sinks and a steam indoor shower. Bardessono has the perfect location, walking distance to all the great spots in Yountville. Overall, we would stay here again and would recommend it. Their restaurant's service was lacking and their food left us wishing we had tried something else. Definitely go to Ad Hoc for dinner or brunch and make reservations for the wine tasting at Joseph Phelps.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: ciaotuffy
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Bardessono in March 2011. Despite the stormy and dreary weather, we were able to stay cozy and warm in our suite. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. When we arrived, we were offered a welcome glass of wine. The receptionist showed us to our room and showed us some of the features of the room. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a room with steam shower and extra alcove with tv and bed. We didnâ€™t need the extra space but it wouldâ€™ve been great if we had brought our kids. We had a small outdoor patio and a nice fireplace that kept us warm. The room was modern, clean, spacious and relaxing. The bathroom was very large with a nice Jacuzzi tub, steam shower and outdoor shower. There was a mini fridge in the room with bottles of filtered water. The hotel was peaceful and serene, a perfect weekend getaway. The location of the hotel was perfect, right in the heart of Yountville within walking distance to the great restaurants. I had an in-room massage treatment before we checked out. It was nice since somebody came to set up the massage table, candles, music, etc. The therapist just showed up at appointment time. It was so perfect to not have to walk to the spa in the rain. The therapist was very friendly and professional. We didnâ€™t use any of the other facilities in the hotel nor did we eat at the restaurant. Overall our room was nice and comfortable, and we have already booked our next stay. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: alysiakc
Reviews.Content: Service was absolutely wonderful! we stayed here for part of our honeymoon and never wanted to leave. The staff not only got us into any restaurant we wanted, booked our wine tours, and helped with every need, but they also sent s champagne and hor'dourves as soon as we got to our room. This hotel is in a perfect location for any wine tour. The spa is beautiful, the atmosphere is amazing and relaxing, the rooms are gorgeous and outstanding, and I really cannot say enough about the staff. We truly loved every minute.

Reviews.Title: “As good as advertised”
Reviews.Author: dbrianf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bardessono for a 3 day trip to celebrate my wife's birthday. We had just arrived from doing a long race, so the in-room massage our first morning as just what we needed. Sonia was amazing, best massage I've ever had (out of ~30 in my life). The rooms have a great layout with a nice flow. We stayed in the Tufa Suite, it had a relaxing feel from the moment you walk in when the automatic blinds slide up and the TV's relaxing music is on. The steam shower is amazing, a nice plus. And the outdoor shower is always a great sign of luxury and something my wife and I enjoy. The outdoor patio provides a private setting to sit in the sun and enjoy a meal. The pool is awesome, either for lap swimming in the morning or hanging out in the afternoon with a cocktail. The restaurant was solidly delicious. In general, we received a handful of complimentary items (champagne, a free birthday drink, etc) which makes the salty price a little bit easier to swallow. Absolutely no complaints on this location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 10”
Reviews.Author: PICKY15
Reviews.Content: Ok-truly this is THE best place to stay in Yountvile. I personally checked out ALL of the other hotels that are rated well here on tripadvisor, and you can't beat the location and amenities.We loved everything about this hotel. The service is exceptional, our room, a tofu suite was gorgeous-lovely steam shower inside and outside shower as well. Beds are delicious-slept like a dream with yummy 1st rate sheets. Charming two sided gas fireplace. Our room was cleaned whenever we left-we got 2 or 3 fresh robes daily! Amazing! Killer rooftop pool with huge private cushioned cabanas and spotless out door jacuzzi with views of the mountains! Have lunch served up there! Truly luxe at every turn. Breakfast is fabulous (extra charge but well worth the price). French pressed coffee is the best ever and please try the griddle cakes if you are a pancake fan...my husband had every day and they just kept getting better. Immaculate grounds. You can walk to everything due to central location and zero road noise being a distance from 29. Most of the other hotels rated well sit right along 29-check the map before you make your decision. Every single person knew our names and greeted us. Each person when asked to provide a service did so eagerly and then went over and above. Leslie the front office manager was awesome. Hillary the Concierge was terrific. Samantha could not have been more helpful. On and on. Stay here. We are coming back in December. Can't wait! The only thing missing is a fitness center...but we are told they are working on that.....TX!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place !”
Reviews.Author: pumax
Reviews.Content: We bought a special deal via another website and stayed there for one night. We drove up and was immediately greeted by their friendly staff. The decor of the property is modern, clean and luxurious. Check in was a breeze. Our room is on the 2nd floor and have a large balcony with street view. The room is comfortable and large. Bathroom consists of a massage/spa area . The hotel is small but amazingly designed. There is a pond area in the center of the property. It is also very nicely maintained. We didnt ate dinner there but did try their breakfast and loved it. It was a mini buffet. The ingredients were fresh. Again, service was wonderful. We didnt use their spa facilities but did take a tour of the spa rooms. The spa is located in the back end of the property. I found that the spa rooms are small and doesnt have the luxuriousness found around the rest of the property. One main drawback of this place is their lack of amenities. The room doesnt even have a coffee maker ! Their explanation is that they offer free coffee and tea at their common room located outside the restaurant. But I would like to enjoy a cup of coffee in the morning before I leave my room. Also the bathroom lack the amount of small supplies you would find in other luxurious hotels. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place. They also could loan guests bicycles to tour around Yountville. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Napa Valley Luxury”
Reviews.Author: havkidswilltravel30
Reviews.Content: This is a must stay for anyone visiting Napa Valley and the Town of Yountville. Super Zen design with the lastest green technology available. So peaceful, exceptional food and wine. Service was second to none. Walking distance to some of Napa's greatest eateries. This is truely one of the top three hotels I've stayed at anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and luxurious experience”
Reviews.Author: Mrosler
Reviews.Content: We've been to all of the wonderful luxurious resorts and hotels around the world...and none compare to the unique and luxurious experience we had at the Bardessono in Yountville. Situated right in the heart of downtown Yountville no rental is necessary.. you can walk, check out bikes (both cruisers and road), check out a Lexus SUV, or simply jump and land near the best restaurants, bakeries, and tastings you'll ever find... Not to mention the Private tour we scheduled with Doug through the hotel was an experience of its own. My husband and I of three years, got to enjoy the company of two wonderful and sweet winemakers and labels in their homes and on their properties. The hotel itself was very modern, but has all of the comforts of the Ritz...Beautiful gardens and ponds, romantic hammock to relax on, fabulous pool and cabanas(that you don't have to rent, you can just use)...The staff were as friendly as can be and ready to assist in any way possible. The Bardessono is a must try...

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed yet sophisticated Napa experience.”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravelygc
Reviews.Content: Everyone, from the valets to the front "desk," concierge, spa and restaurant staff struck the perfect balance between warmth and courtesy - perfect for the sophisticated yet relaxed atmosphere of the hotel. The rooms, with fireplaces and outdoor showers, are spectacular with an understated elegance that my husband and I favor. The bathrooms are almost the same size as the rooms! One important element to note - although set back, the hotel is in the town of Yountville which enjoys exceptional restaurants within walking distance. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience at Bardessono (having stayed at various of the area's high-end establishments), and are most definitely staying there again on our next Napa visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed at!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ruthie1230
Reviews.Content: I have never reviewed here but felt the need to do so. The hotel is by far the best I've stayed at. Reasons include 1) concierge go above and beyond- mine worked with me months prior to secure restaurants 2) unlimited complimentary bike use 3) wonderful location. We walked to each of our dinners 3) the little things. Each morning we enjoyed the complimentary coffee while eating out bouchon bakery breakfast that we brought into the hotel. Each day the morning hostess brought us plates and napkins to accompany it. Most hotels would frown upon outside food. I rate this 5 stars in every category. Did I mention that I'm reviewing this in the midst of my stay here. You cant go wrong here. Love love love it!!!!?

Reviews.Title: “our #1 hotel to stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: katmahmood
Reviews.Content: We just recently spent our 1 year anniversary at Bardessono the end of March. It is our 4th stay in just under a year and a half and it never disappoints. I first surprised my now husband for his birthday and then he surprised me a couple of months later with a proposal in which the staff organized candles, champagne, they drew the bath...needless to say this place is our special place. For starters, the valet is free, the valet guys are always super friendly. The grounds are so beautiful and the place is LEED certified. When we first saw the room, my husband and I tried to play it cool but we were dying inside...the fireplace and the shades and the lights are all just a switch. The bathroom is the same size as the bedroom. The double vanities are beautiful, the bed is SO comfortable and there is a sitting area so you can turn and watch tv in bed or on the sofa. They all have a little patio (we prefer ground floor as it is more private). The steam spa is a nice upgrade when the weather is warmer so you can use the outdoor shower. The soaking tub is our favourite! We never leave without getting into it at least twice! Also, they are VERY pet friendly. My dog, who is also a hotel snob LOVES it. They provide bowls, a bed and a toy. They even allow cats, so we actually took the whole family this last trip. I always order room service, their breakfast is REALLY good...and I want to make a special mention to Crystal who works there and ALWAYS makes us feel like part of the Bardessono family. She is so sweet and welcoming. Also, when the weather is warm, the pool deck is great, the only downside is they don't allow pets on the deck which basically means we never get to spend time there because we love bringing our small dog with us. We have never used the spa services because we basically eat and drink wine and soak in the tub! For dinner, I HIGHLY recommend Chiarello's Bottega. p.s. we once stayed at some other hotel and walked by Bardessono green with envy...so when we are in Napa, this is our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms feel institutional and cold; overpriced for the experience provided”
Reviews.Author: LA-Elvis
Reviews.Content: Room had an institutional feel. Very cold feel. Bed was excellent but the other seating, a couch/ottoman not very comfortable and had the appearance of something that would be found in an office more than a bedroom. Wood floors in bathroom and stone floors in bedroom would have been better reversed to help the warmth. Hotel is very new but already looks a little worn on the furniture in the room. Also the siding of the hotel looks like it needs to be restained, however maybe that's a green issue. Outdoor patio concept is good but with that being the only view the landscaping needs more work around the private patio. Put the iPod cable in the room for the tv. I wanted it a couple of times but never bothered to ask for it. Basically, a great architect created a stunning facility and the rooms have a good layout, but the interior design team totally failed. The staff were all excellent, particularly Tony and the others in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: yreme
Reviews.Content: I hate to review this hotel because I know occupancy will become a issue on my next trip but feel obligated. This hotel has perhaps the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in and that is just the beginning of how good it is here. We took a group of 14 couples for a trip to Napa and stayed at this hotel. The staff was amazing and accommodating in every aspect from room booking to food and beverage. The restaurant is first class and there are plenty of outstanding neighbor restaurants as well. I cannot say enough about this hotel just fantastic. The only down side is we forgot toothpaste and they gave us a tube of Tom's, that is simply the most god-awful thing I have ever tasted...But thats really my fault isn't it?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ItalianGal81
Reviews.Content: Very elegant hotel in Napa Valley with great food and decorations. Location is also great, walking distance from restaurants. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: drnewfie
Reviews.Content: Trust Everything that's been written! If you can get in here (under 65 rooms) do it! True luxury... The spa suites are a lot of fun...taking a steam shower set at 120 degrees: heaven! Free use of the Lexus and carbon fiber bicycles, I mean c'mon who can beat that?

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite boutique oasis in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: strainie
Reviews.Content: Bardessono is a quaint and peaceful place. Techincally a hotel but hardly a hotel. Bardessono is thoughtful, simple and mindful. The property and it's footprint are well suited for the area. There is a beautiful little herb and vegetable garden available for guests to meander. The lobby is far from traditional. The reception desk is simply that, a place to greet guests from a podium. Guests immediately feel the warmth of this property. The entry to the property is home to a few uniquely old olive trees and a few rows of vines. The mountains behind the property juxtaposed by mountains on the other side speak to the tradition and history to this pristine Valley. The service, the commitment to environmental stewardship, the simplicity of the rooms, the luxury of the patio & room furniture, the patio off each room, the jacuzzi tub in each room, all contribute to the overwhelming calm Bardessono exudes. A very special place indeed, may you be so lucky to find yourself a Bardessono guest some day!

Reviews.Title: “expensive luxury”
Reviews.Author: dvoit77
Reviews.Content: i went here as part of my honeymoon and it was fantastic. the staff are more helpful than any other hotel i've ever been to. when we asked for a recommendation for a bottle of wine with dinner, they actually picked one that went well with our dinner rather than just pick the most expensive one they had. everyone there was friendly. there are great wineries in the area. some you can walk to, others you can bike to. some others require a drive but the concierge can arrange for a company to take you around to some different places. the restaurants in the area are equally good. the only problem is, the place is really expensive. i only went there because i figured i should splurge on the honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe”
Reviews.Author: Grigs
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Modern clean lines. Friendly and ultra professional staff. Walkways through the magnolias and a lovely courtyard for a glass of wine as the sun goes down. Yountville is a really pretty village and perfectly situated off of the tourist trail. Has some great restaurants within a gentle stroll but the food at the hotel is great too. Some rooms are double story and some single. Double story have better views but depends which way you face as some look over the road to the village. I think I would go for the single story with courtyard. Lovely trendy bar. Couldn't fault it

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Experience”
Reviews.Author: clevind34
Reviews.Content: Truly first rate across the board. The concierge (Hillery) was extremely helpful in coordinating our days. She coordinated our driver for our wine tastings and it was a great experience. In addition, we had an early flight on Sunday morning. The Concierge coordinated to have our car warmed up, baggage assistance and they even made us coffee at 4:00 A.M. Unbelievable!! Truly made an impression. The sales agent at the spa (I believe Samantha) was exceptional. The weather in Napa was cold and wet and my wife sent me on a mission to find a some alternate clothing. Samantha was extremely helpful. She helped me find what I was looking for, allowed me to take it to the room for my wife to try on and then call her back to have it charged to our room. Hands down one of the very best experiences we have had at a hotel. We will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the top 3 hotels I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: pinklady06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel quite a bit and this is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. The service is wonderful from the free valet parking to the fully electronically controlled room (fireplace, lights, window shades). The rooms have fabulous touches like full wardrobes. Ant ladies, the lights in the bathroom go down the side of the mirror instead of along the top (no shadows when applying makeup). A small thing, but few hotels take the time to do that. The hotel is in the most perfect location in Yountville. It is within walking distance of Bouchon, Bottega, Redd, French Laundry. Absolutely FABULOUS hotel, can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience.”
Reviews.Author: easyriderCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I was at the Bardessono with my significant other, sisters, and brothers-in-law for a decade-birthday celebration in the wine country, and the staff made us feel welcome and "special" throughout our stay. (Many staff members went out of their way to wish me a happy birthday.) We liked the simple, quiet, and elegant decor and high-tech "green" amenities. We know that going green entails some risk and a considerable investment, and we appreciate the effort that went into making the Bardessono as eco-friendly as possible, while not sacrificing luxury. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: PJF405
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently went to Napa and stayed at the Bardessono. It was wonderful! Eco-chic spot with excellent service and beautiful, relaxing rooms that were clean, large and thoughtfully appointed. Excellent restaurant (fit for foodies) and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: Theguyin4B
Reviews.Content: It is hard to write a negative review when a hotels staff is friendly and kind. The staff at Bardessono where friendly and warm. The hotel on the other hand was not. Staying in the famed wine county of the Napa valley conjures up vision of warm cozy inns, B and B's, and country cottages. Bardessono is done in stark modern minimilistic decor. The rooms have no carpet, little furiture and have fireplaces that don't warm the room. There are no chairs or stools in the dressing room-bathroom. The flat screen TV is wall mounted and makes viewing from bed difficult and blured. The walls are thin and I could hear my neigbors both upstairs and next door. You get the feeling it is more important to be trendy, then comfortable. One big laugh was the toilets (men women combo) located off the bar. I love the heated seats, and the automatic lid up feature when you aproach the throne, but be very careful before you push a button on the seat control panel. You are in for a BIG surprise. lol

Reviews.Title: “Real Napa Style Life”
Reviews.Author: WasaShu
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, splendid magnolia in the courtyard. Great view and fantastic swimming pool. Fresh food and very good wine. This is real napa style life!

Reviews.Title: “The Bardessono is the best place and location to stay in the Napa Valley!”
Reviews.Author: BrownSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We love Bardessono! The location, the service, the food and the rooms are fabulous. We have stayed at many 4 and 5 star hotels in Napa but we always choose to come back to Bardessono. We love to walk to all the incredible restaurants such as Bottega, French Laundry, Bouchon, Redd etc. After your evening or day of wine tasting, you come back to your peaceful, spa like room, with steam shower, outdoor seating, fireplace, all the amenities you would want to relax and enjoy! Beautiful property in the best part of Napa, Yountville, does not get any better!

Reviews.Title: “The best in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: Jan0223
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent three days at Bardessono and recommend it highly. It was our second stay at the hotel this year and again - we were not disappointed. The staff is great and the location ideal with the best restaurants in town within easy walking distance. A perfect way to enjoy the Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wkamasaki
Reviews.Content: The Bardessono is a beautiful hotel! Quiet, very peaceful - walking distance to great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Features, and Location, but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: pdesilva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bardessono in late August and loved our time there. Pros: The rooms are spacious with a fire place, patio and tons of high tech gadgets. Bathrooms are huge as well with indoor and outdoor showers. The whole place is LEED plat certified. So, complementary refillable water bottles, refillable soaps, etc. Nice lap pool with a lot of day beds to lounge around. Probably the best perk is the location. The hotel is right in the middle of a bunch of great restaurants including French Laundry, Redd, Ad Hoc, and Bouchon. We had dinner at Bardessono's own restarant and it is very good as well. Also, the concierge is very helpful and I would recommend reaching out to them prior to your arrival for any reservations in the area. Cons: Not cheap by any means, but worth it. Also, we heard that the hotel Googles guests, which could be unnerving for some. Side note: For nearby wineries, pass on Opus One and try Cake Bread and Stag's Leap instead.

Reviews.Title: “Yountville's finest...”
Reviews.Author: tom90210
Reviews.Content: We love the Bartessono. This is our second time staying here and it's even better than we remembered. The rooms are very large with great windows and light. Get one of the "Steam Shower Spa" rooms..it's worth the extra $$$. We have already booked a trip back her in the Summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay -- great location”
Reviews.Author: pcalhoun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are not into modern decor... But we loved this hotel. Great service starting from the check-in experience, where the receptionist walked us to our room. Fairly small hotel, but very quaint and inviting. Would recommend going there when the grapes are in season and the weather warmer. The outdoor patio we had showed fantastic views. Will most certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection, the attention to detail surpasses any Four Seasons or other 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: JodyAustin
Reviews.Content: From the moment of arrival, the staff knew our names and were extremely professional. The hotel room was perfect, clean and luxurious. We had a minor issue with room service charges and the person that answered the phone resolved it immediately. It wad a non-issue. The free bikes are high end and the grounds are immaculate. The staff at thr bar and restaurant were very frirndly. We will come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “A stunning resort getaway in a quaint little city! Not to be missed!”
Reviews.Author: 2catsinphilly
Reviews.Content: Bardessono is a must for anyone visiting the Napa valley! Wonderfully private suites with comfy beds and luxurious bathrooms (spa tub, steam and outdoor showers, and dual vanities). Exactly as pictured on their website. Grounds are spectacular with lush vegetation and water meandering throughout. Would never guess there are 60+ suites. Service is impeccable; everything you need is waiting for you. Lovely extensive continental breakfast each morning. Great rooftop pool. Inviting bar. Bicycles to ride around town (and to Domaine Chandon) a plus. Stayed five nights and wished it could have been longer! We'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, beautiful, peaceful, friendly and tasty - all wrapped up into one!”
Reviews.Author: kbaillie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just had the pleasure of staying at Bardessono for the third time in two years. We loved it the first time around, and it keeps getting better with every stay. The LEED Platinum certification is impressive, but it should be said that the "green" nature of the hotel sure doesn't get in the way of comfort and luxury. The modern design is remarkably cool & beautiful, with the mixed use of natural and man-made materials resulting in a very high-end yet pleasant vibe across the board. The rooms are huge and the appointments are super comfortable. Our suite had a double-sided fireplace, a steam shower, jacuzzi tub, outdoor shower, plenty of private patio space outside to lounge in. Short of an insanely opulent trip to Mexico for our wedding, I've never set foot in a nicer room - no joke. The restaurant serves great grub, and the bartenders really know how to make a cocktail. Being a cocktail snob (sorry, the Burritt Room and 15 Romolo in SF have ruined me for life), there's nothing more refreshing than bartenders who make a proper drink not only using the right ingredients, but the correct techniques too. The hotel isn't exactly cheap, but we felt like we absolutely got our money's worth (or more) by the time we left. What really helps from an emotional standpoint is that they don't nickel & dime you for things. Examples: valet parking is free. Bike "rentals" are free. Filtered water in-room is free. For these same things at the Fairmont Sonoma Mission Inn & Spa, a couple would be charged ~$100 ($25/day parking, $6.50/bottle of water, $30/day for a bike). All in all, we couldn't recommend Bardessono enough. Whether you're visiting Yountville for the awesome food (it's a 1 minute walk to the middle of Yountville's main drag) or just looking to get a few moments of peace & rest, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Romance and Beauty”
Reviews.Author: TourBus510
Reviews.Content: From the time we drove up in the car, until the time we left we had such a great experience. The entire staff was very friendly and knowledgable. We loved the aesthetics. Great restaurant too. We highly recommedend Bardessono.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Lindaa78
Reviews.Content: The only regret is that we only stayed 1 night in this gorgeous resort. Conveniently located with many tasting rooms within walking distance. Great luxurious room abs bath made this most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “For your zen getaway, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLaura
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a surprise. From the outside, I thought, "holy moly, this is it?" But wait...this is a hidden gem! The rooms are peaceful, beautiful and with just the right blend of luxury and simplicity. The fireplaces in the bedroom are romantic, the patios are lovely, the furniture is fab, the bathroom is zen like. You will enjoy the tub, the his and her vanity areas and the space for dressing. The bed is comfy. This is far from Stonehenge but just as impressive. Go and stay! This is the best place to stay in the area. Enjoy the design, enjoy the experience, enjoy the calm.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful-modern green hotel resort”
Reviews.Author: wpaapw
Reviews.Content: I made a spur of the moment decision to stay here as I was having dinner at the French Laundry restaurant and it was raining that evening thought it was appropriate not to drive of course drinking wine and driving home entered into the equation too, called the place after checking yelp and trip advisor and was able to negotiate a better than advertised deal. We arrived in the evening and while the rain poured so visually it was distorted but right away they approach your car and staff drom check in comes out to you, provided an umbrella and made the arrangements for our room, then complimentary shuttle to the restaurant. The place was as good as the best places I've been this travelling year but the surprise was the next morning when I saw how beautifully arranged the place was and certainly couls understand the numerous honeymoons planned here for the Napa wine country. It's a modern resort with great service and accomodating staff. I recommend this to anyone that travels and needs the extras, beautiful bathrooms terraces and fireplace huge sony television iphone dock and A/V connection console. we loved it and much more than the dinner -another review-

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: FGM-VA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just a few months after the place opened in May 2009, and again this November. We love this hotel. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the bathrooms are the best of any place we've ever stayed. The staff are unfailingly polite and helpful. We also appreciate that the hotel does not nickel and dime you to death for every little "extra", like so many high-end hotels (Ritz-Carlton,Four Seasons, Intercontinental, Fairmont). Valet parking is included in the room cost, as it internet service--thank you, management. The internet is especially helpful to look up info on wineries you might want to visit. We had dinner in the restaurant and it was our best meal in Yountville--better than Bouchon, and infinitely better than Bottega (awful meal). Everything is just beautifully designed and well-maintained. The only negative on either stay was on this trip, we had a ground floor room with a second floor room above us. Many of the rooms/sections of the hotel are single story with no upper room, which I will request next time. Whoever was in the room above us stomped around like a Clydesdale. We were awakened by the noise around 2am the first night, and again around 7am the next couple of mornings. Sometimes it sounded like they were doing laps up there--constant walking back and forth for 15-20 minutes! But this wasn't enought to spoil our stay. We will definitely return at the first opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest stay in Yountville with a few caveats”
Reviews.Author: Tar Heel Bill 92
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our mothers and our dog, just returned from a 4 night stay at the Bardessono Hotel. My husband and I have been to Napa Valley many times, previously having stayed at Auberge du Soleil, Calistoga Ranch, the Yountville Inn, and in a condo in Napa. Yountville is my favorite place to stay because of the many restaurants in walking distance and its relatively central location to most of the wineries we visit. The Bardessono is a wonderful addition to Yountville, and we definitely enjoyed our stay. Our likes included: (1) Spacious rooms--we had a Tufa Suite and our mothers had a Queen Spa Suite with 2 queen beds. Nice sized bathrooms, too. (2) Modern, clean decor--we enjoyed the design aesthetic, though we can understand that others might find it a bit too spartan/minimalist. (3) Location, location, location--superb location, just a short walk from all of our favorite haunts in Yountville, including the Bouchon bakery across the street, and Ad Hoc, Bistro Jeanty, and Redd all just a short walk away. (4) Very dog friendly--our dog loved it, and this was our first time traveling with him (a 100 pound Rigeback). We had a doggie bed, water bowl, and blanket waiting for him on our arrival, and the staff was always happy to help with anything we needed to accommodate him. (5) Service--the service was great. Anything we wanted, we got. We did have one snafu with coffee being delivered after too long a wait one morning, but that was our only complaint. I didn't feel well one night, and the staff even offered to fix me something on the house from the kitchen. Things we didn't like: (1) Restaurant--the restaurant is very pricey and doesn't have a lot of options. Breakfast was pretty limited, and extremely expensive--$19 for an omelette is a little extreme, especially when it just isn't that big. Dinner is pre-fixe, though they did try very hard to accommodate our special needs, but it didn't quite compare to any of the many restaurants in town. We tried to avoid eating here, frankly, after our 1st dinner and breakfast. (2) Spa--the facility, itself, doesn't exist. It's just a restroom and treatment room. I think they hope that people will do treatments in their rooms, which is part of the reason for the design of the rooms, but my husband and our mothers definitely didn't feel like they got a true spa experience. The treatments, themselves, were fine, though, they told me. (I don't do spa at all, myself, so I could care less.) (3) Bathroom clothing storage/towels--we realize it's a green hotel, but for these rates we expect green to still be luxurious. The towels were just shy of being pathetic for these room rates. I realize recycled is good, but they reminded us of towels from a Holiday Inn. Not good! We want green in a luxury format, or else we happily sacrifice green to get the luxury! We also wish there had been more storage drawers/shelves in the bathroom for our clothing. All in all, we were very pleased with the Bardessono. I certainly expect that we will stay there again. We just won't eat in their restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Green living creates a serene, yet well oiled machine of efficiency & comfort.”
Reviews.Author: beth_christensen0313
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were amazed at the quality of service and the serene surroundings. Our room was beautiful and the atmosphere of the whole facility was incredible. Your staff is helpful, courteous and efficient. I am so happy we were able to find you and will use your facility in the future. Thank you for an enchanting evening =)

Reviews.Title: “Best weekend experience”
Reviews.Author: Andi092
Reviews.Content: The Bardessono caught our attention online when we searched for a romantic weekend getaway. The concept of "green " sounded interesting and the rooms stood up to it. We liked the modern style which still had a warm feeling to it (as sometimes modern can mean too bold ) .The outdoor shower was heaven and the dinner AMAZING. Outstanding service .The location very quiet. We;ll go back in a heart beat! Thanks for a great weekend experience!

Reviews.Title: “Like a fine bordeaux -- grows on you with time”
Reviews.Author: TSPrufrock
Reviews.Content: Just finished a multi-day wine country trip using Bardessono as a home base. The service and location make the experience ideal. The staff attitude is casual and not at all pretentious. Staff understands its customers, and works to make the vacation about the customer, not the hotel. Like the foliage and the room, everything blends into the environment, which is nourishing and relaxing. We got good dining reservations, a quiet and spacious room, and help whenever we needed it. The price is relatively high, but unlike many other high end hotels there aren't a ton of hidden extra expenses. You genuinely feel like you get what you pay for. Also an ideal location for great day trips. Only one regret -- and I understand why. The shower pressure/water volume is low. It is appropriate given the green nature of the hotel, but a killer high pressure shower is one of life's great guilty pleasures and would have made the therapeutic nature of our Yountville vacation complete! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooning at Bardessono, Yountville - Napa Valley.”
Reviews.Author: Shadyrmn
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I were planning our honeymoon and wanted to visit Napa Valley, we found Bardessono by coincidence and it turned out to be perfect for us as a romantic, private escape. The hotel is located in a small town called Yountville, which is very beautiful and full of fine dining restaurants and it's people are very friendly and helpful, someone actually pulled over and got out of his car to ask if we needed directions as we seemed like we were looking for a place that we can't find. Bardessono it's self was a spectacular experience, the layout and landscape is just perfect, the rooms are "smart homes" with mechanical blinds and automatic lighting along with the automated fireplace, and of course Video on Demand and top of the line IP phone system, the bathroom was huge with a wonderful large tub and the room also had a nice private patio terrace. The Restaurant is a fine/gourmet cuisine and the same goes to the in room dining. The place is also a spa that I bet is wonderful as well but we didn't get a chance to experience it. The staff is outstanding, very presentable and very friendly and extremely helpful, made as feel very welcome and at home. the place is surrounded with wineries which we went for a tour that was just great. shopping is also close by. if you are looking for a get away from the cities for a romantic event or just for relaxation this is the place to be, it appeals to ladies for the beauty and relaxation and the guys will enjoy that too along with the environment friendly technology that the place is built on making it modern and up to date with a homey and warm look. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best service I've ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: jeffled1134
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bardessono for the second half of my honeymoon. It could not have been better. I was there close to Napa's harvest season and the weather and scenery were perfect. Absolutely everyone I encountered at Bardessono, from the concierge to the valet guys, automatically went way out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. After check-in, I was oddly greeted in our room by a complementary bottle of sparkling wine, fruit and cheese, and a nice personal â€˜Congratulations on your weddingâ€™ note from the staff. Where does THAT happen, anymore?!? I canâ€™t stress it enough. This place is worth it. Iâ€™ll most certainly be back. By the way, if you are either a food or wine lover, you have to go for a visit. Just do a search for restaurants or wineries within 10 miles. Be prepared for a lengthy and delicious results page. Long story short, this was probably my best hotel experience, ever. Thatâ€™s coming from a guy that spends around a quarter of every year in hotel rooms all around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base camp for Napa explorations!”
Reviews.Author: LoveLuxuryHotels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Bardessona for 3 nights over Halloween weekend with my husband and some friends. It was a very luxurious stay: -Rooms are incredible. I am not sure what some folks in other reviews have found negative about them; they were def. 5 star level per US standards. - Lobby area was fabolous, especially the wine hour was great to take back a glass of wine to your room without opening a bottle from the days collection before dinner. - Location- although it does not have the romantic feel of residing in a vineyard like some other properties like Auberge, it was perfect for walking around the town for dinner or tastings. We did Bottega (good), Bouchon (good) and Bouchon bakery (incredible!!!) around town. Overall, it is a perfect base camp to hit up 29 and Silverado trail, especially if you are with friends and do not need to be in complete seclusion. Very nicely done and will surely return with friends; but will try something more romantic if it is just with the hubby.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary Service in a Tuscan (Napa) Enclave!”
Reviews.Author: Dalecorp
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay in all aspects with some of the most courteous, helpful and exemplary staff one could find anywhere. All of the staff from housekeeping to the concierge to the grounds keepers go beyond the call of duty in helpfulness and making guests feel welcome while contributing to ensuring the finest stay possible. Housekeeping itself is amazing with an electronic call button eliciting almost immediate response no matter how many times a day engaged. The grounds and facilities are immaculate complemented with state of the art spacious rooms with a staff ready and willing to take care of your every need no matter how specialized. We have stayed in some of the finest hotels in the world, but this boutique hotel is really top notch with the only negatives relating to the aesthetic atmosphere of the dining room and the priciness of the spa services. Definitely worth the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel everyway you look at it.”
Reviews.Author: toes2thenose
Reviews.Content: "Green" Hotel that is a beautiful place to stay with large rooms, great spa services, great atmosphere and a location you can walk to everything in Yountville (If you feel you must). We loved the hotel and the service. Great friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “great in many ways, disappointing in some”
Reviews.Author: foodie0075
Reviews.Content: We finally felt we had found a great place to stay in the Napa valley. Beautiful, very large room with a patio. Huge bathroom with two sinks, huge tub, and separated bathroom and shower. It is well designed. It may not be for everyone -- but if you like organic contemporary style, you will enjoy it. Excellent location, in walking distance from great restaurants and shops. Unfortunately, we had two problems. First, they provide water in the room that has been triple filtered. I drank a glass before I realized it had something peculiar floating in it. The hotel's reaction to this was not satisfactory. Moreover, we had requested a quiet room (not that one should have to request this). I had concerns about the location of the hotel, and unfortunately they were realized. At 7 am, we were awakened by the sound of multiple trucks backing in and out, either delivering items or picking up trash. We were awakened by more trucks an hour later. Then, vacuuming commenced next to us or upstairs from us. The reaction we got from the front desk was to basically argue with us about whether or not we had requested a quiet room. In general, the staff was well meaning, but inexperienced and it showed. I liked it enough to return, but only if I were guaranteed a quiet room (and, honestly, I don't know if they have any).

Reviews.Title: “most relaxing, conveniently located, over the top service resort ever!”
Reviews.Author: floridaskiers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with another couple and we all LOVED this place. The service was over the top - starting before we even arrived with Lydia, the concierge, helping us plan our dream itinerary. She took our suggestions, then added some of her own and really made this trip for us! My friend and I had massages - both of us agreed the best we have ever experienced - while our husbands watched some football at a local bar. The Bardessono is just PERFECTLY situated for all you need! Don't miss the Sunday Supper! The best deal ($39 per person for four courses) and some of the best food we had on our trip and we had some powerhouses to compare it to...auberge du soleil, bottega, ad hoc and bistro jeanty! We all woke up daily and walked Yountville and ended up across the street at Bouchon Bakery for a melt in your mouth pastry and then headed out for another harvest day of tastings in the valley. Pondering how much fun it would be to own a little place in town we all realized our money would be better spent staying at this beautiful, restful accommodating resort instead - thanks Bardessono!

Reviews.Title: “This will be where we stay on our next trip to Napa & Sonoma!”
Reviews.Author: freebirdVT
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at a very nice Inn in Sonoma on this past trip, but had the opportunity to tour Bardessono and have lunch in their outdoor cafe. The hotel is completely green even using ionized water instead of detergents! The atmosphere was very relaxing and pleasing to the eye. As for the staff, they were very pleasant and patient with the many questions we asked regarding the facility. The food was organic and locally grown whenever possible. We had an opportunity to tour both the vegetable and herb gardens. The food was the best we had in the area. I would recommend this hotel and certainly plan to come back to Yountville specifically to stay at Bardessono.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: budinct
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Yountville for the first time and enjoyed 3 nights at Bardessono. First, the location in Yountville is perfect central location for going to Sonoma, St Helena and Napa. It is an easy drive for winery hopping or bike riding. Second, for great dinners, it is a short 2 minute walk to all the outstanding Yountville restaurants. We hit Redd, Bottega and Ad Hoc. All were outstanding. For breakfast we did Bouchon Bakery. The peanut butter and jelly doughnuts are awesome. They have these only on weekends. The hotel was perfect. Clean, friendly staff, great pool, awesome spa services in your room and a great steam shower or outdoor shower. The property has a nice relaxing zen feel. Can't wait to go back and worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “The room felt like a spa”
Reviews.Author: llamaeyes
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I've ever stayed in. The staff was attentive but not irritating catering to what we needed. The property is green and designed with attention to the best way to build and utilize the sun to heat the property. Shades are on the outside of the windows so they keep the glass from heating up. Rooms had lots of windows but were open but shielded from the other units with well-placed dividers. The bathtub was near a window and under a skylight. My biggest complaint was that there was a detector of some sort with a small light over the bath that fliashed. Really not much of a concern while watching the stars from the super-deep tub.

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced for what it offers”
Reviews.Author: kaolock
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Bardessono in September. On the positive side the hotel is located right in the middle of Yountville so you can walk to all of the restaurants, however you get no view whatsoever of any vineyards. Also I appreciate their LEED effort, which they have done quite well, but feel they need to put more effort into actual guest services. I have to agree with many of the comments posted by the Sydney couple. The concierge staff is not so much rude as totally incompetent and just not very knowledgeable or helpful, especially concerning vineyards. We asked about a vineyard designed by the Swiss architects Herzog & de Meuron and they made us reservations at a vineyard they thought was called Coyote (it was actually called Quixote, like Don Quixote) and was designed by the Vienesse artist Hundertwasser, which couldn't be more different than what we were looking for. When you are paying $825.00 a night you expect the concierge to be a valuable source of information and to be able to get you into restaurants and vineyards and have some inside connections. Not only were there no connections the concierge were fairly clueless, we had better restaurant recommendations from the bartender at the hotel. The rooms have absolutely no view as said in previous posted comments, so one would never use the balconies- they face parking lots and solar panels and the backs of other rooms. Since the fronts of the rooms are glass walls, there is little privacy unless you have the shutters down, thus eliminating any natural light. A bottle of complimentary wine was left in our room but the dirty glasses from the first day just sat for 2 days until I wrote a note asking them to bring clean ones. The maid service was really not up to par, especially for this expensive a hotel. Also breakfast was not included. At that price that also seemed quite outrageous. The great bakery Bouchon is across the street, they could have offered complimentary coffee, tea and croissants from them at the very least.
