There seemed to be many other places in Yountville itself and around the area that offered far greater value for the price. I would never consider staying there again nor recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I Wouldn't Come Back”
Reviews.Author: Oceans1
Reviews.Content: This is a very late review for a stay we had at Bardessono in May. We stayed for 3 nights and I have to say I wasnâ€™t that impressed and wouldnâ€™t come back. The hotel feels sterile â€“ lacks atmosphere somehow. Our room whilst nicely appointed with all the mod cons just felt utilitarian and cold. Our balcony looked out over the solar panels of the adjacent building and the car park and we were never once tempted to use it. Apart from one staff member at breakfast and the valet staff I found the service to be inexperienced and at times down right rude. It was raining heavily one evening as we were heading out to dinner and as there was only one umbrella in our room we asked at reception for another - we were walking to dinner and the umbrellas are fairly small. The answer was an abrupt no because only one umbrella is allocated to every room â€“ at $700 + a night not acceptable!! In general the staff tended to have a â€œtoo cool for schoolâ€� attitude and we even found this to be the case with the guests which added to the overall lack of warmth and atmosphere. The concierge was snooty and unhelpful. Weâ€™d been a bit slack in planning some winery visits and some of the places we wanted to visit were by appointment only. When we asked about these wineries she literally rolled her eyes and said it would be impossible to get into them at this late stage. Never offered to call and try. We went back to our room and called them ourselves and sure enough were able to get in. I donâ€™t care how eco friendly this hotel is it needs to get the basics of customer service right first.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: NYCVACAGAL
Reviews.Content: I can not say enough great things about Bardessono. The hotel staff is incredibly nice and accommodating. The location is fanstasic -- Yountville is our favorite town in Napa since it is off the highway and has restaurants, shops, a market and a great bakery all within walking distance of the hotel. The hotel grounds are immaculate and intimate. The rooms are huge and clean. The bikes are fun and definitely worth going for a ride around the area and through the vineyards. The rooftop pool is relaxing, refreshing and clean. The pool chairs are comfortable and there are many options whether you want to read, eat at a table or take a nap in a cabana. Their commitment to being environmentally friendly is important to us and we appreciated all the small details. Overall, it was a fabulous hotel and we cant wait to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Quite a way to wind down and round off our holiday around California”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_and_Anna
Reviews.Content: Great place to splash out. Great town to splash out in given the number of stunning restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “A simply outstanding experience from the front door to the room to the dining room etc.”
Reviews.Author: vinjilldi
Reviews.Content: We simply loved Bardessono. Lydia at the concierge was absolutely excellent - Crystal took us to our room and did an oustanding job of explaining what was available and how everything worked - Billy was superb in the dining room. And, the cuisine was remarkable. I could go on :) :) :). All of the rest of the staff were all excellent and very helpful - we just don't remeber all their names. We will be back and already telling all of friends about our Bardessono experieince. Thanks so much for making this stop the highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: tennisbuffMidwest
Reviews.Content: So beautiful, restful, luxurious and clean! So glad we stayed here. Pool, spa, restaurant, and bar were all top notch. The rooms with private patios were awesome. Beds and linens super comfortable. Loved the indoor/outdoor showers too. The bidets in the lobby were a life changing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Stones7
Reviews.Content: Being fairly regular visitors to the Napa Valley we like to try new places, so when Bardessono opened up in Yountville we decided to give it a try. Ultra modern, but for me a little more bleak than chic - the design seems to be inspired by wooden boxes stacked on each other, almost like oversized warehouse shelving. However the rooms are very comfortable, and the amenities first class. We booked a room with jacuzzi bath and outdoor shower, but felt like some others that the room lacked some privacy as it was overlooked by the gantry leading to the upper floor rooms opposite, so we weren't brave enough to try the outdoor shower! The staff were helpful and unobtrusive. Professional, but not quite warm and friendly either. So all in all we had a comfortable, but somewhat sterile experience at Bardessono. But as a higher end establishment close to the great restaurants in Yountville, it certainly ticks all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious Hotel With a Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: careyparis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week long vacation in Napa. We spent the first half of our vacation at Hotel Luca and the second half in an Elevated King Suite at Hotel Bardessono. The character, service and personality of Hotel Bardessono didn't bode well for us; At it's core, Hotel Bardessono is a pretentious hotel whose allegiance are the wealthy. My wife and I are young, successful entrepreneurs. We are in our late twenties / early thirties, and we didn't really "fit" in. We were the youngins', and our experience was a feeling of disadvantage. We arrived at dinner before several couples, but we were last ones served. Service was remarkably short, and we weren't offered a wine menu until we asked for one. We arrived at the bar along side several another couples; we walked in and sat down before them, but we were last ones served. Concierge was nice, but they didn't really spend quality time helping us plan our days. They would bounce back and forth from the phone, to other guest questions and then need to be reminded about the questions we originally had. (A quick side note to say thank you to Kevin, though. He was the only one who really showed outstanding service. Thank you, Kevin!) Other than Kevin, service at this hotel appears to be relevant to your image, in our experience. If you look like you have money you will likely be treated like a king. If you don't, well -- who knows. There are a few other notes that may be worth mentioning: 1) There are rooms which have showers outside. These are their most expensive rooms, I believe. Be careful with these rooms. The Elevated King Suite is on the second floor, and the rooms with showers are on the first floor. The angle of the shower exposes you to those who walk down the stairs. We could clearly see the shower. Nobody was using it, but it is sold as a more elite experience...so be careful if you plan on using it. 2) The Elevated King Suites have a view of the parking lot or some condos, that are under construction, in the back. You would expect to have a view slightly more appealing than a parking lot when you pay almost $800 a night for a hotel. 3) The food is not that great, and the presentation is forced to meet the hotels elite yet minimal standards. Don't let the presentation masquerade the taste of the food. Save your night and walk a block down the road to REDD. You won't regret it. Finally, make sure to check out the pool. It is the best pool in Yountville. If you are looking for a luxury hotel that will truly treat you like a king, though, go to Hotel Luca. Their pool may not be as awesome, but it is hands down the best hotel in Yountville.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: StacyP101
Reviews.Content: We paid $725 for an elevtaed spa suite and spent $11,1100 for one night plus dinner and lunch at the pool. Four Seasons prices and no where near Four Seasons Service! Pool was not at all crowded and we had to go up to teh window finally for service. One entree at dinner was just so, so, lobster salad was truly mediocre. Cool room, but looked out over a parking lot and cheap houses and condos. Not at all what I thought it would be and certainly nto worth the price!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SixtyDays
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night on a jetsetter.com deal and really thought that Bardessono and Yountville were a real highlight of our roadtrip through Oregon and California. The modern design and beautiful space that has been created was very peaceful whilst at the same time being in the centre of everything at Yountville. Our elevated spa suite was large and well-maintained and we enjoyed the large balcony on which we had breakfast. The service was also fantastic, and Dolores who checked us in sent us a complimentary bottle of wine to celebrate our anniversary. This is the type of service that one expects and it is great to see Bardessono deliver on these expectations. Yountville itself is a fantastic place to stay in Napa valley with amazing restaurants and a lovely vibe to it that we really enjoyed. It was a real highlight of our trip and we hope to return again one day. I would especially recommend eating dinner at Redd (great food and atmosphere) and going for a wine tasting session at Ma(i)sonry - great service and wine tasting in a beautiful setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilties, but the service sets it apart from all others”
Reviews.Author: EVolFan
Reviews.Content: Fanatastic design, ammenities and location, but what sets this resort apart from it's sister five star properties in the Napa Valley, was the attention to detail and service by each member of the staff, who from the waitstaff and up were obviously empowered by management to do everything possible to make your stay relaxing and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, ultra-contemporary, beautiful room with huge bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: sherryshoes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip to Napa after having spent a couple of nights at a more rustic location. This was extremely modern, minimalistic in design, but extremely comfortable. Everything here is "green" and so cool! We were there during a quiet time of the week and felt like we almost had the place to ourselves. Breakfast was included and very nice and fulfilling. Great large lap pool on the roof with private cabanas. Close walking distance to everything in Yountville. Wonderful, light bikes that can be rented free of charge. A very cool and different experience!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC BOUTIQUE HOTEL.....EXCEEDED MY EXPECTATIONS.”
Reviews.Author: fabfinds
Reviews.Content: Well for such a traditional girl I sure enjoyed this modern hotel! Everything about it was fabulously wonderful, comfortable and luxurious without being stuffy or too pompous. We loved the location, right smack in the middle of Yountville, walking distance to all the great restaurants and a short drive to all the wineries....just perfectly situated. The rooms were great, luxurious and modern. Very spacious also, huge bathroom with enormous soaking tub, we had an indoor and outdoor shower, huge closet/dressing area. Beautiful and very large deck wtih comfortable furniture. I loved going out there late afternoon when the temps started dropping, reading a book, sipping a glass of wine.....wish I was back now! The beds were super comfortable, automatic blinds and lighting system made everything easy, and plasma mounted on the wall. I love how all the rooms have wood floors throughout, the bedrooms, sitting area and bathrooms. It was spotless and the service and everyone we encountered that worked there could not have been friendlier. We only ate breakfast and lunch once, and it was very good, beautiful setting. My husband used the spa and enjoyed the massage but book ahead, they are a busy little spa! Loved it and would definitely recommend it as well as go back....in fact can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Addison_texasWendyw
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel! Great service and perfect location to all the highly rated restaurants in Yountville (Bottega, French Laundry, etc.) and major wineries. The only slight drawback is that the rooms on the second floor do not have great views BUT the rooms are comfortable and the bathrooms are spacious. Breakfast was included in the price and a good start to the day. Both of the concierge people we used were friendly, informative and very helpful. Will definitely return to this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location!”
Reviews.Author: mdkohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a lower level suite from June 1 - 6. The service at the hotel was wonderful. This was our first time to Napa. We traditionally really enjoy contemporary hotels. I will try to cover some of the questions I had about Napa, as well as some of our thoughts in response to earlier posts. Style First off, this is a modern hotel with a very modern/contemporary architecture. If you don't like that, don't stay here. If you prefer a Victorian B&B with frilly curtains and such, this is not for you. We loved it. Comfort/Function The bed was very comfortable, as was the room. It had all of the amenities we wanted. The patio area was great. We were in Room 204, which was a lower level, however, we had privacy because our particular room did NOT have a suite above us. I'd read that some thought these were not private, but ours was. The patio was enclosed and had a table and 2 chairs, as well as 2 lounging chairs with ottomans. It was very comfortable, and nice to eat breakfast at and/or drink wine in the evening. The bathroom is huge as others have said. There are 2 closets, which was very nice and there was room to store both of our suitcases in the closets. In addition, the bathroom was large enough to house the 5 cases of wine that we purchased. Spa My husband did a manly facial and 90 minute massage. I did a 30 minute massage with a polish and wrap and a facial. We both enjoyed it. We did these services at the spa, not the room. I loved the Clarita products, and my husband loved the Dr. Alkaitis. The pool was great. Try to spend at least a couple of afternoons there. Beautiful mountain view and plenty of cabanas/beds available. Try the Moscow Mules (a Napa kind of version of a Mojito, I guess). Food We ate breakfast at the hotel dining room every day, except one when we ordered room service. The Croque Madames were AMAZING. They are obviously very high in calories, but an excellent "base" for a day of wine tasting! Room service was prompt and actually fairly affordable. We never had dinner at the restaurant, but we did have a light snack at the pool - chips and guac (great!) and a light snack outside the bar (cheese plate and the Iberican ham - very good!). The outside areas are beautiful and it is great to eat outside at Bardessono. We ate dinner at Bouchon, Ad Hoc, Bistro Jeanty, Hurley's, and Redd. We chose to walk to dinner every night, which was great. I highly recommend the location of this hotel. Ad Hoc was amazing. It was sirloin the night we went. This was our favorite restaurant and we highly recommend. Bouchon was noisy and crowded/tight, but our food was great. The sommelier was very helpful, and we had beet salad (loved it), lamb (great!), short ribs (very good, but I did like the lamb better), and hot brownies with almond ice cream (yum!). Excellent service, we loved our waiter. Redd - we did the tasting menu and wine pairings. Great! Definitely recommend this. Good service, but not as good as Bouchon. Bistro Jeanty was great, more casual. Our service was a little slow, but we did sit outside. We had the tomato soup (one of my favorite foods on the whole trip), butter lettuce salad, lamb (good, but not as good as Bouchon), duck (really good). Recommend this place as well. As for Hurley's, it was good, but compared to these amazing places, it was just average. I had the salmon, good, but just not the caliber of these others. I probably would have repeated another restaurant this night or gone to Bottega. Hurley's does have a really nice, pretty patio (we sat inside) that would be very nice to have a casual meal or drink. We had lunch one day at Rutherford Grill - highly recommend. We had the enchiladas (amazing) and a Hack salad (chicken). Wine We did 2 days of wine touring with Bruce Conard of Wine Country Safari. We highly recommend Bruce. We did rent a car for the week, but it was great to have Bruce do the planning and driving. Do not go with Bruce if you want to go to a lot of tacky, overpopulated wineries where people are getting drunk and wine is mass produced. DO go with Bruce if you want a unique experience and want to taste and buy wine that you will not be able to buy back home. We loved every place we went and almost always met the winemakers. It was an amazing experience and now we have wonderful memories associated with the wine and every person we met. Price ranges were $20 - $100. We bought 5 cases and had all but 1 checked as baggage on Delta - we bought wine shipping boxes. It was a great way to do it. The wineries we went to were mostly by appointment. White Cottage Ranch, Siduri, Boeschen, Bremer, Benovia, V Madrone, Raymond Burr (gorgeous place for a picnic), Martinelli, Acorn, and David Cafforo are the wineries we went to over 2 days. We also walked to the tasting rooms at Cornerstone and Somerston in Yountville - very good and close. We had a wonderful experience and will be back. I wouldn't have changed anything about our trip. It was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “above expectations!! great location”
Reviews.Author: sarmufmaf
Reviews.Content: Hotel Bardessono is a new property in Yountville. The architecture is modern and very unique. The lobby and bar area are surrounded with gardens and sculptures, the pool which is located on the roof offers dramatic views. Our room had a nice garden and a spacious bathroom with very nice & generous amenities. Breakfast was included in our room rate and on top of the continental buffet it included a hot dish as well.The staff was very accommodating. The fact that we could walk to all of the great restaurants in town was a feature.I have been to Napa Valley many times and I must say that this hotel is by far one on the best.

Reviews.Title: “Green Luxury and Wow Service”
Reviews.Author: Winetrvlrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and loved it. Unbelievable rooms, high tech, spacious and who can complain when a fold out massage table is the room. Wonderful food, great pool events, and pool. Nice art, loved the garden boxes and free bikes to pop around on. Just wish the price hadn't doubled from this summer compared to last summer. The owners and designers get an A. Did I mention the service? Better than Four Seasons. We would return in a heartbeat and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lilwojo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our honeymoon and it was the perfect way to end our honeymoon. We booked an elevated spa suite and it was worth every penny. The grounds were chic and trendy, the rooms were comfy and spacious. We loved the working fireplace, the enormous tub, shower with natural products and the plush beds. Make sure you book a in-room massage! And if you need to ship wine back home, the nice people at the front desk can do that for you. And don't forget to get the croque madam every morning at breakfast. DELICIOUS! We definitely will go back for one of our anniversaries!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing ... I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: travel-candy24
Reviews.Content: Bardessono was a true find. I am not typically a b&b traveller, so bardessono, with it's clean architecture and modern amenities that were superb but not stuffy, was perfect. It's located in Yountville, which is north of Napa, and close to multiple vineyards in the area. On a day without traffic, it's an easy 70 minute drive from San Fran, however next time I would consider flying into Oakland to avoid bridge traffic. Yountville is a smaller town, but it's beautiful. There are flowering plants everywhere; it's very accommodating to walkers/joggers; it has top notch restaurants; and it's a bit more secluded from the main drag going through all the surrounding areas. I chose a spa elevated suite at the resort/hotel. I'm glad I got a room on the 2nd floor; even though I didn't see any of the other rooms from the inside, they seemed as if the ground floor suites might be a little claustrophobic outside in some areas. We were checked in very efficiently, and taken to a room nearby. It was gorgeous. I felt, the entire time, like I was staying in my own house. Past the small entry way is a large bathroom to the left and a large living space to the right. The living space was clean and modern, with fantastic lighting, a plasma screen TV, and a gas fireplace. It also had a large sitting couch and a sizeable deck off the living area. The deck views leave a bit to be desired because all the roofs are flat and have solar panels; but I didn't really mind this. The bathroom was as large as the whole living area. It featured a space for a hide away massage table, as well as two large wardrobes. Vanities were situation opposite each other (there were 2), a huge soaking jetting tub stood under a large private window, and the shower was glass enclosed. The room attendants were like choufes! We never saw them! Even when we were away for 20 minutes, they managed to sneak in, tidy up and replace our water. The resort provides free triple distilled water in old style milk-like containers to your mini bar a few times a day. Every night at turn down, there is a new bottle with a fruit wedge next to the bed. You feel perfectly at home. Unfortunately I did not have an opportunity to take advantage of the spa services (they were booked in the short time I was there), but they now have a small spa if the guest desires service outside the room (which I appreciated). The staff was superbly friendly. The bar attached to the restaurant is definitely a good stop for a cocktail. The recipes are very inventive; I had a cocktail with citrus vodka, homemade gum liquor, lemon juice, and a pinot noir top - it was amazing. I didn't have a chance to enjoy the restaurant, opting to dine at Bouchon across the street instead (fantastic - must go!). The only drawbacks were the mini bar and inroom dining - from my perspective. The mini bar only had water. Because there are not really "stores" a-plentiful around that area, I expected at least something to be stocked in the room (especially when you get back from a day of wine tasting and want a snack!). Also the in room dining menu is fairly limited, and gets more limited as the night goes on. Snacking after dinner is not really an option (although wine is available and some very small other items). Obviously this can be worked around as long as you know in advance. All in all, I was extremely sad to leave bardessono and will definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Valley Gem”
Reviews.Author: sd1968
Reviews.Content: Best new find of 2010 for my wife and I. Sleek architecture, slick use of technology, beautifully designed gardens (with sculpture), private space, superb staff, good food and of course in an excellent location for exploring the valley. Go there to relax, to eat well, to exercise and sleep - the beds were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Zen relaxation mixed with a new wine fascination :)”
Reviews.Author: la_sirena_yeye
Reviews.Content: Oh how I've yearned to be amongst high society friends commenting on fine wine a la 'Frasier'; however, my palette never acquired a taste for wine... [enter Bardessono] During an anniversary vacation with my hubby I mentioned to the receptionist that we are not wine people. She asked what types of drinks we like and although I said I also did not like champagne she assured me that the fruit forward taste would dance gentle circles on my tongue to my liking. She was right. My hubby enjoyed the sparkling wine too... idk, maybe it was the romantic views and the whole experience itself but now I LOVE (sparkling) wine and although it's really champagne I'm glad I tried something new. So obviously I thought the staff was great. The hotel is minimal but plain in a chic way. The spa is small but luxurious and calming. As for the outdoor showers in the room, make sure to check that it works when you get the initial tour and walk through of the room. Also, the restaurants in walking distance are divine! And you can bike ride there with the free hotel rentals. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly Staff - Chic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Zeebs3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent the 2nd part of our Honeymoon at the Bardessono - we had high expectations after vacationing at a Four Season resort - they were met! Free valet parking, free breakfast, free bottled water, they even had a bottle of chilled champagne and chocolates waiting for us in our room - all nice touches. With so many Hotel options in Napa Valley we were torn on where to stay. Bardessono is in the heart of Yountville and within walking distance to Bottega, Bouchon, Bistro Jeanty and Redd (went to all!!!). The staff, servers and bartenders were extremely friendly - they took care of reservations and even arranged shipping for several bottles of wine we couldn't lug back to the east coast. The rooms are very spacious and tricked out! Turn down service was spot on, our vanity lights went out and they offered to upgrade us to a larger room! The pool and hot tub were great after a long day of tastings, we didn't have dinner at the Hotel but the breakfast was great. The Bardessono goes to great efforts to assure your stay is relaxing and enjoyable - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “A very modern hotel with great service - wonderul experience”
Reviews.Author: Tomot
Reviews.Content: If staying at an interestingly designed modern hotel appeals to you, then you are likely to love this place--- if your idea of getting away is to be in a room that offers a four poster bed and lots of lace, then it will not. I fall into the former category, and I was extremely pleased with the design of both the grounds and the rooms. The hotel is situated in "downtown" Yountville and is within very easy walking distance of a lot of great restaurants including Bouchon, Bottega, Redd (we dined at these three) and also ad hoc and French Laundry (where we did not dine). On our fourth night we ate at the Hotel's restaurant which ended up being our favorite dinner of the four we had in Yountville -the atmosphere is contemporary, the service was professional and the meal was excellently executed and creative - the chef did a good job of preparing the food with bright and fresh flavors and sauces that were more on the light and clean side rather than heavy and cream based . We also had breakfast each morning at the hotel's restaurant - it was included in our rate but I'm not sure that it is typically included - it was quiet good with a large variety of choices and good (blue bottle) coffee and a selection of teas. I read other reviews on tripadviosr that expressed some mild dissatisfaction with the hotels dining room.... our experience was the opposite; we really enjoyed the breakfasts, our dinner, and had excellent service. Bardessono (along with the other hotels and the restaurants in Yountiville) is just a handful of blocks off of Route 29, the main road running N and S through Napa Valley; consequently, we could hear a bit of traffic noise from our balcony (not loud, but a muffled background noise that probably will only bother those very sensitive to noise). However, we did not notice any traffic noise during the night. We did not use the spa services, so I cannot comment on them. Also, we did not use the pool since the weather was unseasonably cold. There is free valet parking --- three of the four nights we parked right outside of the hotel property on the street just because we thought it would be easier. However, the one night we used the valet service, they were very prompt in getting our car.

Reviews.Title: “Yountville -- a gem in the Wine Country of Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: savvy_travelers_2010
Reviews.Content: We searched fivestaralliance.com to locate a luxury resort in Napa Valley and found the Bardessono. Having never been to Napa, my husband and I didn't know what to expect. The hotel is beautifully appointed, modern, green, and located in a wonderful community called Yountville -- quaint, charming, with a number of Michelin rated restaurants all in one spectacular location. The staff at the Bardessono were friendly and accommodating ensuring that all of our expectations were met. The complimentary breakfast/brunch was amazing and the onsite restaurant was fabulous. A few steps from the resort is Bouchon Bakery, a place everyone should visit and adjacent to it, Bouch Bistro. You can leave the hotel and never get in your car because everything is within walking distance with many spectacular restaurants and too many to visit in a short five day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: dawgday13
Reviews.Content: Outstanding staff, everyone from bellmen to bartender to concierges were pleasant and bent over backwards to be helpful. Rooms were huge and well-appointed. Had a privacy issue with all the windows at first, then realized that the windows without electric blinds were one-way windows... so privacy was not a factor after all. Didn't get to eat in the restaraunt this time, but will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Really Cool, Really Beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Spiritjw
Reviews.Content: Beautiful modern hotel in the adorable town of Yountville!! Friendly staff! Enjoyed the food at the restaurant! Hip pool & patio. Didnâ€™t bring our swimsuits because we thought it would have been too cold for swimming, however we could have because the pool was heated! Next time! Really loved our upgraded room! Very spacious with a fabulous fireplace & Jacuzzi! I love Napa & this is a perfect place to stay if you want to be pampered at a trendy hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lavenderra
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the Bardessono in Yountville. Because its so nice, we decided to stay another night. The design, amenities, service and general appearance of the hotel is very nice. Its a beautiful place to stay for many reasons. The rooms are spacious with lots of privacy. Its very high tech (central controls for lights, window treatments etc.), the staff is friendly, helpful and easy to talk to. The roof top pool is beautiful and a great place for sun bathing, reading or taking a nap. I'm traveling with 2 teenage girls, who are having a great time as well. We would come back here in a minute for some good R&R and general feel good time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed With Bardessono!”
Reviews.Author: syrahgirl
Reviews.Content: Wow, this places was perfect! I loved the contemporary design of Bardessono, all of the wood and iron were very pretty. We were shown to our room which was #118 on the second level, it was the "wow" factor with a flat screen TV, spacious balcony with nice patio furniture, the bathroom area is stunning with a jacuzzi tub, glass windows that are sensor-controlled, spacious walk-in shower and two separate vanites with gorgeous sinks and faucets. We loved the comfy bed and in the small fridge there are several bottled waters in glass. We took advantage of the bikes and rode around Yountville and out to the vineyards. I spent alot of time at the rooftop pool and the jacuzzi, nice rubber mats are provided for floating in the pool which was heavenly, with the warm, sunny weather on Sun. morning. Breakfast was very good and you get your choice of one hot item off of the menu, service was friendly and professional. This green hotel offers all of the comforts of home in a very contemporary setting. You can walk to all of the great restaurants in Yountville from Bardessono, we walked over to Bottega for dinner. There is complimentary wi fi that worked very well. Our stay was flawless, you can't wait to return again again to Bardessono. My only regret is not trying their restaurant for dinner, next time! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Smma
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the best suite, fantastic in every way!! Great service, location and experience. If you want to do wine country in style this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: kaanapali72
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff, well appointed, very comfortable. Top notch. Luxury. Well designed, green!

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist green luxury”
Reviews.Author: oaklandbrownbear
Reviews.Content: Eco friendly Immaculate Beautifully appointed Quiet The best hotel I have ever stayed in Amazing restaurants within 1 block

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: nikki95
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal including free breakfast and decided to try the Bardessono on our trip to the Napa valley. We were very appreciative to get an early check in as we arrived on a red-eye. The staff gave us a brief tour of the hotel and the room with all of its ammenities. The room was gorgeous and huge! The bed was so comfortable. We had a large flat screen TV as well as beautiful fireplace and refrigerator with free triple filtered water. The bathroom was HUGE---two seperate sinks, one with a make-up mirror, soaking tub, steam shower, two large closets with bathrobes, and an in-room massage area. The outside patio was private and comfortable with table, chairs, trees and even and outdoor shower. The staff was exceptional, especially Estelle (restaurant manager) and Marshall (valet). Estelle greeted us each morning and came over to chat making recommendations for shopping and sightseeing. Breakfast was fabulous. There was a buffet table with the most delicious muffins and ham I have ever tasted. There was also chocolate croissants and other breads, fresh fruit, cheese, juices and cereal. We also got to choose one hot entree. We took advantage of the free bikes available to hotel guests and rode around Yountville. Marshall, the valet, was always there when we returned to the hotel to take care of our car and help us with our baggage and packages. The hotel is a "green" hotel and everything is designed to conserve energy. The lights and shutters close every time you leave the room. It is also very high tech---there is a dryer that blows when you are done using the soaking tub. So many neat and modern features. The design and finishes of the room are beautiful with wood, stone and fabrics very tastefully selected. Overall, our stay at the Bardessono was just perfect from start to finish. The room, the staff, the location (literally in the center of everything in Yountville and walking distance to all the great restaurants---Bottega, French Laundry, Bouchon, Redd...). We can't wait to return to this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Detail, Great Service and Outstanding Location...Lucious!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: Wow! Green building, Trendy, Sexy, Comfortable, High Tech, Friendly, Helpful, Cheery, Romantic, Fun, Relaxing, Convenient (within walking distance of some of the best restaurants in the country), Beautifully landscaped, wonderful details..........give me more superlative adjectives and I'm sure they will apply. The only aspect I would hesitate recommending is the restaurant. Breakfast was good/interesting but service was not all it should be for this caliber of establishment. I've heard the same about dinner.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place.”
Reviews.Author: julias
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Bardessono in early November. Because it was off season, we got a great rate for this property. I agree with all of the other positive reviews. What an awesome hotel. It is not your typical Napa Valley hotel, so it may or may not be for you. It is sleek, modern (very), and so tranquil. It is not rustic or antique filled, and you would be hard pressed to find ruffles of any kind. We had a king spa suite with a huge soaking tub and wonderful steam shower. The bathroom was enormous. The living area was spacious and light. There was a private patio outside our room, which would be great in warmer weather. We went swimming at night, and the pool was really warm. As others have said, the hot tub is HOT. Nice though. Room service was great, but I didn't enjoy the restaurant as much. The location is near some fabulous restaurants. The Bouchon bakery across the street is also a great place to grab a quick coffee and croissant. I also highly recommend Bottega for dinner. All in all, Bardessono is a wonderful, peaceful place in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “not perfect, but very close”
Reviews.Author: awdub
Reviews.Content: The property itself is fabulously designed, modern yet very comfortable. Rooms were a very nice size, and beautifully furnished. The green features were very nice and intriguing, but the motion sensors weren't perfect - when I was working in my room, the blinds would occasionally decide to lower themselves. The ability to have an in-room spa treatment was wonderful, and the treatment itself was very good. Linens, etc. were generally very good - the robe and towels were a bit lighter weight than I was used to, but that probably is in keeping with the environmental theme of the property. The free water and wireless internet was a welcome touch, and the high-tech docking station was very nice. Unfortunately, except for the wireless internet, business services are pretty much non-existent at the property - of course, this resort is meant for relaxation rather than work, but the in-room desk was prohibitively small, and the only way to print something out was to ask to borrow one of the concierge's computer for a while. If there's a chance you may have to work while on-property, be prepared. We ate on property a few times and were very impressed with the food and the restaurant / lounge service. The chef is really taking some risks with the menu and some flavor combinations and pulling it off beautifully - we loved the dinner that we had on-property, and even thought that it was a tiny bit better than Redd (which was also impeccable). The lounge had a good cocktail program, and seemed to have a lot of local buzz (which makes sense, I suppose - if you live in the area, non-wine focused bars may be a bit hard to come by). The location is perfect if you want to be in walking distance of the valley's best restaurants and a number of great wine bars. That's exactly what we wanted, and we were very happy with the location. There was a bit of noise from the elementary school across the street and from local construction - it wasn't too bad, but if you're looking for a rustic retreat, this may not be the place for you. The check-in service was fine and the bell and valet staff were superb - I can't say enough good things about them. The one glitch was at the end of the stay, when two staff members were openly complaining in the reception area about a wedding-planning couple who wanted to come view the property with only a day or two's notice. It was a jarring note to the otherwise very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Well done, cozy, green (LEED certified)”
Reviews.Author: sasima
Reviews.Content: We adored this small hotel. Normally, we'd stay at the Carneros Inn, but decided to make Yountville home base this time. And, given its green creed, we wanted to check it out for that reason as well. The design is ultra modern (sharp lines, square & rectangular shapes dominate), but it didn't seem cold at all. The feeling you get is warm, comfortable. THE ROOM We had the Steam Spa-Suite w/ 2 queen beds. I find it hard to believe that it's only 550sqft. It looked much more spacious. Everything felt open, good natural light during the day. Everything worked off the push of a button... Want "do not disturb"? Push a button. Want the blind to go down? Push a button. At some hotels, all the fancy buttons can get complicated, but not at Bardessono. Everything was easy to operate. - there's a mini-fridge in the room. Each day, there are bottles of filtered water bottles (glass) in there for you. They always gave us 4 (there were 2 of us). - I like extra firm bed, which theirs were not, but it was fine. - the beds are not set side by side. There is a partition between the beds, which is nice. The 2nd bed is in its own little "room" w/ no door w/ its own tv. - the fireplace is not that big, but it warmed up the room very well. - we thought the heating system was very efficient. There were no cold spots in the room. The temp felt even all throughout the room. - the bathroom was beyond huge. Plenty of closet space (his/hers). Dual sink. Soaking tub is super deep. - the lounge chairs in the patio are nice. But no heat lamp to keep you toasty. THE POOL They keep it at what I think is the perfect temperature. At least 80 degrees for sure. You can jump right in, you don't have to go in a bit at a time. - good for lap swim. Comfortably fits 2 lap lanes, 3 doable. - the jacuzzi is small. And very hot. I would say it fits 2. You can fit 4, but you won't be able to spread out. BIKES The bikes are complimentary of the hotel. You are taken over to the "bike garage", where you will be outfitted w/ a nice bike. There is a nice bike path that runs right next to the hotel. SERVICE Overall, service was efficient, polished, personable. High marks for that. HOW GREEN Well, it's pretty green. The place is heated/cooled by many geothermal wells (I think over 80) & of course solar panels. Furnishings are made from reclaimed materials such as wood & steel. The rooms have energy-saving motion sensors to detect room occupancy, lights will go off automatically.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine2006
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a great stay at Bardessono. We stayed in the standard spa king suite and the room was huge. Unfortunately it wasn't warm enought to utilize the outdoor space, but the room did have a large outdoor patio and outdoor shower in addition to the spacious indoor space. The design was amazing - loved all of the high-tech details and the fireplace in the room that starts with a flick of the switch. I think the wi-fi was free and there was no charge for phone calls, local or long distance. The steam shower was also a nice feature! Amenities in the room included free filtered bottled water (in glass bottles to be eco-friendly), robes, slippers, and nice smelling bath products. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating. The check-in process is very easy and personalized. They are awaiting your arrival at the front desk and you are immediately shown to your room, no waiting. Again, I wish it had been warmer when we visited because the outdoor pool and hot tub area was very inviting with a fabulous view. The grounds and property in general were very nicely maintained. This was my first stay in Napa Valley and Yountville is a great town to make your home base. There are so many great restaurants within walking distance - so wonderful after a day of wine tasting when you don't want to have to drive anywhere. I didn't take advantage of any of the spa services or the hotel restaurant so can't comment on that, but check out the individual bathroom stalls located just outside the restaurant and near the bar area. They have the super-deluxe Japanese style Toto toilets with a heated seat and lid that automatically raises and lowers. Maybe these are common on the west coast but I've never seen one on the Midwest. Cool!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: RCRGator
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bardessono after hearing recommendations from friends and really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The bathrooms were heavenly. All the gadgets in the rooms were interesting treats too - the automatic shades, the push-button fireplace, the TV with personalized settings, etc. The staff was accomodating and prompt. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Probably the best thing about the Bardessono though, is its location. We never once had to drive to dinner and walked to Bouchon bakery for breakfast every morning (which is delicious - you have to try it!). Additionally, the Bardessono offers a wine shipping service from the hotel if you piece together a case from your favorite vineyards bottle by bottle for a very reasonable price and you don't have to package anything. We got a great rate from booking non-cancellable way ahead of time....were we not to get such a good rate, I don't know that I would spend that much again to stay at the Bardessono but it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Green and gorgeous.”
Reviews.Author: alwayswandering002
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by it's green credentials.This is not a mung bean eating vegan retreat but a stylish,luxurious boutique hotel.We stayed two nights after a short drive from SF.The hotel is well located in Yountville a short walk to some marvellous restaurants ( including "French Laundry",if your pockets are deep enough ) and the rather cutesy attractions of the town.Wineries abound and are easily accessible.The hotel is very modern in design and luxuriously appointed.The rooms are very large with a very generous dressing/wardrobe/bathroom areas.The common areas are very well appointed in an understated luxury style.There is a restaurant on site but we did not sample it except for breakfast which was very good. The staff were helpful with advice about retaurants and wineries.There is a spa on site with a good range of "treatments".

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: Canada9424
Reviews.Content: Exceeded our expectations on every level , high tech environmentally friendly resort.. Well trained staff, Large spacious rooms , great menu and well priced....Fabulous !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best way to do the wine country!”
Reviews.Author: lanerikeel
Reviews.Content: The Bardessono exceeded my expectations, based on the reviews I had previously read. The hotel is gorgeous, the staff beyond fabulous, the food was out of this world, and the spa provided some of the best treatments I have ever expererienced! It was an A+. The location in Yountville was so charming. Everything in town is in walking distance. Again, the staff was first rate and I plan on making this an annual trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to relax and the staff was great”
Reviews.Author: ShoTrace
Reviews.Content: All in all a very nice place to stay the minimalist design and eco-friendly rooms were a nice change of pace vs. the Napa standard Tuscan feel. If you are looking for the warm feeling that a room with carpet gives you - this is not your kind of place. However if you like clean lines a wonderful jetted tub with champagne bubbles this is the place. The only issue we had was it rained and our room service was all wet - they have not figured out how to deliver food in the rain.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but soulless and needs time...”
Reviews.Author: bavers22
Reviews.Content: Firstly although I rate this hotel as average, that is average relative to hotels in this price bracket. It's clearly above average compared to all hotels. The room was nice, great size, comfortable and nice gadgets thrown in. The bathroom is huge, fantastic. This place falls down in two areas....firstly it has no character, it's soulless and I'm not sure if that's because it's new, or it's just too empty and feels a bit too ikea-ish. We stayed for 3 nights and hardly saw anyone. I like quiet relaxing holidays, but this was just boring after awhile. Secondly it isn't worth the money, we paid about $500 a night plus taxes etc, so all in closer to $600. It's just not a $600 a night resort, yes the rooms are good, but it feels a bit like an ikea man made lifeless hotel and therefore if i were to ever go back to the napoa region i'd head to auberge or one of the other high end resorts. if you're in the wine country you want to feel like you're in the middle of nowhere and this didn't have that appeal. So all in it's very hard to score this hotel, location is great for the restaurants pf yountville, but too much of an in town feel, rooms are great, but the hotel is just lifeless and not worth the money to be honest...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect luxury!!!”
Reviews.Author: JSRNYC318
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to the Bardessono last weekend (Aug 27 to Aug 30) and couldn't have asked for anything more! The hotel is gorgeous and caters to your every need. From driving up and being greeted by the valets to the orange and mint water left on our nightstands each night, we had the best time. The bathrooms were impeccable! The shower had wonderful water pressure and the tub was such a pleasure after a day of wine tasting. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed the spa center and got two treatments each (facials and massages) and could have kept coming back for more. The service was top-notch and something we both definitely noticed. Upon arriving at the pool, you are brought a bucket of ice water and ice, without ever asking. The only downside? The restaurant. It was good (my husband had the beef and I had the cod), but not the best meal of the weekend -- Salmon at Bouchon was to die for and Redd was GREAT! Overall, my husband and I would return in a heartbeat to Bardessono. It's proximity to all the restaurants and wineries coupled with its own luxuries make it a no-brainer in Yountville.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryTrixie
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 days at Bardassono and I can only say it was heavenly! Stunning rooms that felt like home, large bathroom with separate areas for each person, large jacuzzi tub and separate shower. The entire complex was fantastic.....clean lines, modern and roomy. Lots of little extra's made it extra special, fruit flavored water daily, free bikes for guests, free internet, free long distance calling within the U.S.A. valet parking at no charge (except for tips), free use of the Yountville Gym across the street and a fun pool party on Wednesday nights that is attended by locals and guests. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We contemplated staying a couple more days but decided a trip back in November will have to do!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: clevergirl61
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place! From the smart shades on the windows to the self cleaning tubs, this is what the standard for a "green luxury" resort should be. Absolutely private and romantic. The rooms are simplicity and style at its highest form. Deliciously flavored waters bedside at turn-down, fireplaces and flat panel television, soft organic bedding and towels. And don't miss the view from the pool area! Perfect! The water features around the property are relaxing and the spa is wonderful. But very best of all, you are walking distance to the best culinary road in wine country. Across the street is Buchoun, French Laundry and just a couple of blocks away Redd. And all of the great tasting rooms of Yountville; including Masionry as well as Hope and Grace.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: marge11
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 wonderful nights at the Bardesson after 3 nights in Glen Ellen at the Gaige House (which was also wonderful). This could not have been more different -- sleek and modern and very green. The rooms are huge, the views from the 2nd floor pool area overlooking the mountains are spectacular, the bicycles available to borrow are great. Two minor complaints -- the music at the pool was irritating and there is no coffee available until 7:00 am (which if you are on EST is a hassle). Other than that, great place, Yountville is spectacular, had a great meal at Ad Hoc (will definitely go back)and a less-than-great meal at Bottega (will never go back) and kick-start the morning at Bouchon Bakery.

Reviews.Title: “Breathe, Relax, Imagine”
Reviews.Author: caribartTT
Reviews.Content: This has been our BEST HOTEL EXPERIENCE IN NORTH AMERICA of all my travels over the years. I have stayed at many high-end design hotels and Bardessono is leaps and bounds beyond all the others. Excellent "Green" concept make environmentally conscious people like us very happy. The staff were amazing. Jaime @ The Concierge desk was outstanding, meeting our every request and pointing us in the right direction for very enjoyable and unique experiences in the valley. The dining room staff were also very good, remembering our individual special requests each morning we had breakfast. And of course the hard working boys out front: Tim, Marshall and the others . They were all suba courteous and went out of their way to help us with the car, luggage, shopping and our bikes for our morning rides up on Silverado Trail. We will never forget how spoiled we felt at Bardessono including the wonderful side-by-side in-room massages and especially the Butler service was extremely special and very enjoyable. How we miss Bardessono and even though we may be at a very nice hotel in San Francisco, it cannot compare to the pampering and uniqueness of the past 5 days. Im at Hotel Vitale now in the city which by comparison feels like a Days Inn. I sit in my room here and close my eyes and reflect on my suite 306 in Yountville. Thank you to all my friends - the staff of the Bardessono

Reviews.Title: “top marks in all respects !”
Reviews.Author: Garak
Reviews.Content: We found this place on trip advisor and liked the fact that it was brand new and a "green" hotel. Well, we were not disappointed and in fact, we were very impressed. Yes, some people might find the rooms' interior a bit spartan and modern but that style very much appeals to us and hence we loved our room. Especially the bathroom was super, we had the feeling that somebody really wanted to treat us by staying at this particular hotel. The pool area is lovely and the hotel restaurant is excellent. Yountville is a fantastic place to sample excellent food and the hotel restaurant can compete with some of the Michelin starred place within walking distance of the hotel. I suggest that you eat one night in the restaurant (it's worth it) and then in a couple of place in Yountville. With regards to wine tasting, the hotel staff was very knowledgeable and was able to suggest some wineries which are a bit off the beaten track but therefore are much less touristy than a lot of other places Napa has to offer (taste the zins at Robert Biale, unbelievably good!). Well, as I am writing this, I am dreaming of returning to this hotel . . . Finally, we had some spa treatments there which were also heavenly. The massage with hot stones was the highlight for me and leaving this hotel was not an easy thing to do.

Reviews.Title: “A Most Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crash89
Reviews.Content: My lasting impression on my stay here will be that when a hotel goes to such lengths to be all that the Bardessono is all I could think of were the little things that would have really made the hotel the ultimate place to stay in Napa. I'll get to this later and expose how crazy I really am. This place is ambitious! When we arrived we were instantly greeted by a couple pleasant door men wearing uniforms that were comprised of shorts and short sleeved shirts in a beige hue which went with the surrounding; these young men offered assistance and took us inside to a podium where we were checked in and then led to our room as if we were on a guided tour or being sold a unit. The complex is set up not unlike condo units, two stories each of metal and wood with modern art that pays tribute to the past (namely the henges of England and some Greekiness) Still in progress grape vines are growing in the front of the grounds and what I believe to be an herb garden is nestled along the eastern border. The underlying impression I absorbed was that the architects were not fond of curves. Continuing with this theme the room was very sharp both in construction and in aesthetics; it actually made the chamber have less of a flow but that's fine I didn't develop some weird right angle phobia or anything. Our room came equipped with a beautiful flat screen TV, a fire place, a media hub, a fridge containing some water, a king size bed, a couch and ottoman/coffee table and plenty of media about the hotel all in a chic pale. Off the bedroom/living area is the terrace that was quite sizeable while providing a duo of deck chairs a table and chair set up complete with an umbrella to keep off the mid-day to evening sun. The wash room was quite spacious with a tub for two, a stand up shower, a pair of vanities with washing basins and a lot of closet space. This is also where the in room massages take place. An iPod station is located here which connects to speakers in the massage/ wash area which is cool but all I could think about was how really cool it would have been if speakers were available in the bedroom and terrace. I know it sounds strange but this is one of the little things that would have put the Bardessono in the stratosphere for me but I'm also a huge music lover. Included in the technology front would be the automatic shades that come down when the room is empty which is reported to save heat; these are manually controllable from a master panel which switches on lights and fire place as well. The pool experience was a fair, there were many cabana hutches and parasol covered deck chairs for lounging and such. I found the water to be very pleasant though a pool attendant was in need to skim the tree debris from its surface (loudly noted by another guest). While the poolside attendant was friendly and accommodating they close down service at 6PM which is several hours before sunset when the pool closes for the night. The clientele here definitely had an elite vibe causing me to wonder who's life I was living, a topless beauty sauntered about while talking loudly on her phone, a couple next to my hutch talked about scripts and various creatures that could labeled as "arm candy" laid about basking in the golden Napa sun. Our breakfast room service was delivered hot and promptly within the quoted time. Was it the best RS? It was close to it in terms of quality but because of the buildings structure (two stories, no elevator) the server had to make two entrances to our room and two trips up the stairs with the trays. This is pretty inconvenient for everybody involved. Our check out was smooth and the valets were quick and friendly upon departure. As we drove off I noticed that a burnt orange Bentley convertible that was parked in front when we arrived was still showcased in the same parking space demanding the guests know what class of people were welcomed here.

Reviews.Title: “Yountville Chic”
Reviews.Author: RSBJGB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent an extended weekend stay at Bardessono. In short, the hotel delivers as advertised and does not disappoint. Their website tells you much of what you need to know - its a very contemporary, well run, beautifully maintained property that sits in the ideal locale of Yountville. We stayed in the "basic" room, which was enormous, filled with every gadget and amenity you can think of - plus it had a large private patio. The property is obviously very "green", but you don't sacrifice any beauty or luxuries for it. The service is a bit inexperienced, but very attentive and performs well. The roof top pool area is quiet and well designed with comfy louge chairs and plenty of cabanas. If you like elegant, eco-friendly and modern design, this is a stand out property. The other big plus is the location - Yountville, which in my view is the very best place to stay. Fabulous restaurants within stumbling distance and easy access to wineries off Hwy. 29 or the Silverado Trail. Also, being toward the southern end of the valley, there is also less traffic. My only knocks on Bardessono are as follows: Despite the depressed economy, the room rates were quite high - even for their more standard rooms, which are admittedly gorgeous. Still, the place was probably less than half full and they seem to be still charging rack rates. In the end, I'm not sure its worth the big dollars, but that is an individual value question. (One other hotel option to consider that maybe less expensive is Villagio, which is a 1/2 block away and is also quite beautiful and full service.) My other knock on the place, albeit a minor one, is the mandatory valet parking. It's a bit annoying and unnecessary. They have a large lot that one should be able to self park in. This isn't Manhattan - self parking should be an option. Those issues aside, if you don't mind the big splurge for the room rates, I'd highly recommend the property.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Money for an Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mirensmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bardessono for our 10 year anniversary. We did not get to take a big honeymoon after paying for our wedding 10 years ago, so we decided to splurge for our anniversary trip. I researched all of the options in the Yountville area and it seemed like Bardessono was the most luxurious and unique hotel. We arrived with high expectations and left with a feeling of disappointment that we had dropped 500 a night on this hotel. Everyone was nice and the room was great (lots of "gadgets/buttons", but besides the water bottle brought to your room at night, it did not have anything special to it. We were treated like we were a guest at any chain hotel. When I booked the hotel, I told them it was a special occasion and I thought in Napa, they would actually do something special, but all we got was a "happy anniversary" written on the welcome card. The most disappointing thing was our friend was in the Beverly Hills area at the same time and pricelined a hotel at 130 a night, she received THE star treatment. Free drinks, free wine receptions, rooftop party, etc. Overall, we were disappointed for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Could not imagine anything that would be better”
Reviews.Author: avcask23
Reviews.Content: What a sexy hotel. No detail is spared and the service is world class. After visiting Auberge and driving by Yountville Inn and Villagio, I am so glad to have chosen Bardessono. I have no doubt that this hotel, very soon, will be "the" place to stay once words gets out and the economy picks up. The rooms were very clean and large. And the grounds are tremendous considering it only opened a few months back. Marina, the concierge, is fantastic and helped build some wonderful itineraries. The proximity to Ma(i)sonry and all the restaurants is such a convenience...walking to and from the many fine dining establishments is something that should not be taken for granted. Every morning, just hopped the half block distance, and picked up breakfast at bouchon bakery. This is a world class establishment in the most charming city in Napa. ps...by the way, the common grounds - pool is la chic and their cabanas are among the largest i've ever seen. also the lounge and outdoor patio are also incredible. Thanks for all who have shared in the forums/review sections....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful addition to the Napa experience”
Reviews.Author: ppp2
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at the new Bardessono Inn in Yountville, CA. It is a brand new hotel that has incorporated everything a guest could want or think of.... from beautiful linens, lighting, fireplace in the room, a seating area in front of the fireplace and an enormous bathroom with shower and a separate soaking tub. I also liked the lay out of the hotel because the rooms were set up in three sections so for a wedding or business function your group could all be together around one wonderfully landscaped courtyard. The food and service were excellent ... couldn't have asked for more. Yes we would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful visit”
Reviews.Author: ABQNMTraveler
Reviews.Content: Recently we stayed at the Bardessono for 2 nights and had a wonderful visit. I was very curious to learn about the architecture and amenities of green hotels. I was not disappointed. An easy walk to fantastic restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Bliss, *****Stars, Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: lexusboy1983
Reviews.Content: I researched Bardessono for the start of our Honeymoon before flying to Bora Bora. The Staff was extremely welcoming, knew our names, and upgraded our room to a Spa Suite. The staff was always attentive, housekeeping great, rooms very spacious and very romantic. Food was great, room service, staff. I have stayed an many Ritz, Four Seasons, Park Hyatt, etc, and Bardessono was up there with the best. The next Carneros Inn ( which I have also stayed). 2 min walk to Yountville ( I suggest eating at Bouchon) . They were very helpful in arranging transportation, dining, and trips in Napa. A new hotel with only one way to go . UP. Thank you so much for making the start of our honeymoon so enjoyable. Congrats! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular, Inspiring, Luxury and Green”
Reviews.Author: MrSmithLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing. Every single detail was perfect. I work in the hotel business and have worked with the big three 5 star luxury brands, the Bardessono hits it right on every level. I cannot say enough, all of this and its green. Now if I can only learn to pronounce the name.

Reviews.Title: “Good concept, frightening execution”
Reviews.Author: urbanlm
Reviews.Content: Green is great. Modern is glorious. Technological amenities are titillating. But think Yountville and Napa -- what comes to mind? Au naturel, ORGANIC, brilliantly effervescent life. The intent and idea behind Bardessono is "modern green luxury" but the design and decor are out of place in lovely little Yountville. It's empty, cold and bare with lots of buttons to push but without the things that suggest warmth, vitality and energy. Sure, they have automatic blinds, outdoor shower (no privacy), a "private" patio (reflective glass wall ensures the second floor guests see all!), steam shower, blah blah blah. But if you like bare, and the perennial sales pitch, perhaps this is the place for you. It's a new hotel, and it comes with the horrors of oddly trained staff. In their enthusiasm, they effuse on every design detail at every opportunity. Do I want a sales pitch AFTER putting money on the table? No thanks. Every hotel in Napa offers guests a complimentary bottle of wine. This one serves up a noisy, empty cooler, fanning away all night. They did bring by a plate of fruit and nuts, but only to interrupt us WHILE IN THE ROOM -- totally uncool, very unsubtle, go straight to jail do not pass GO. When we arrived, a flurry of FIVE staff started bustling about. But we only had a piece of luggage each, so what's the big deal guys? This insane gaggle of staff once spotted us emerging for the room and RAN TOWARDS us, in the perfect calm of an early spring evening. [--] RUNNING towards us. We should have turned around and ran away. The last straw was that the same thing happened when we checked out, only the rep took the BF's roller luggage, and returned 3 minutes later to take my shoulder strap bag. Ladies first? In all my travels around the world and back again in the hospitality industry, have I ever witnessed anyone so useless/ clueless. Are the staff trained to be this way? It's so PEACEFUL and private and understated at all the "nice" hotels; how can these guys get it so wrong?? What a shame, esp with what they are charging. Think Bardessono and what comes to my mind is -- must get the hell away from this place, can't wait to leave and experience Yountville! And oh, btw, a wonderful couple we met at Bouchon, let us know their concierge at Villagio got them a last minute table at French Laundry. The concierge at the B didn't even bother to try; she didn't even suggest ANY of the other 20 fabulous restaurants within a 10 minute walk, or 10 mile drive. Final oh btw -- we stayed mid-week and judging by the number of cars in the valet-only lot, we were one of three hotel guests. Still, the "service" for in-room dining could not send over cream and sugar for coffee, for whatever reason. Too busy perhaps? What we did like -- bacon extra crispy, beet salad with mozzarella, the cabanas at the 2/FL pool, proximity to Bouchon Bakery, Bouchon, Bistro Jeanty, Ad Hoc, Redd etc., hotel concept. The place is a disaster. Pity.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Service--Beautiful all-around”
Reviews.Author: TravelbySEA
Reviews.Content: I was here with friends for a couple of days in April. The service was the star of this show--they knew the name of our party and always greated us with a smile. They were more than eager to accomodate any request, even anticipating our needs before we even asked! The roof top pool deck was a wonderful touch as we were able to enjoy the sunset and a nice glass of champagne before dinner. Overall, I highly reccommend the Bardessono to anyone looking for a relaxing, full-service, GREEN hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Who knew great hotels could be green!”
Reviews.Author: kathysticks
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I stayed at Bardessono for a couple of nights for a wine tasting weekend. I was excited to try the hotel as it is known as the greenest hotel in America! I have to say that it was worth it. The hotel is very different from most which made for a unique stay. The service was exceptional from check in to check out! We rented bikes for one day which was complementary. We just went to the front desk where they had everything ready and they even customized the bikes for each of us. They also packed us water for the trip. The rooms are one of a kind as you get to see how green the hotel really is. The rooms are called spa rooms and you see why the minute you walk inside. The bathrooms are gorgeous and we were disappointed we didn't get to spend more time inside! They also had herb and fruit infused water waiting for us each night. We also ate at the restaurant and again had a great time. The food was excellent and the service was amazing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially those looking for a unique experience. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A 21st Century hotel with 5 star accomodations”
Reviews.Author: marf54
Reviews.Content: Had a business meeting in the wine country and decided to try this new hotel. Had heard a lot about it in various magazines. Concept is solid. Sustainable hotel with great service in super location. Easy walk to all restaurants in Yountville. Rooms are large and very quiet. Service is good. Design is exceptional with good quality recycled materials. Very different from other places I have stayed in wine country. Took a little while to get used to it but it definately works. Will return with my wife for a wine country weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing . . . absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: BigRicSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in (which was an hour before official check in time, which they had no problem accommodating) we were treated with outstanding service. The hotel grounds, and the rooms were immaculate. Very clean and spotless. The rooms are quite large and spacious, with huge bathrooms. All in all it was an outstanding trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fits in and Green”
Reviews.Author: Seattleeatme
Reviews.Content: Appreciated how connected this complex is with the community and the setting. The staff was quite good even thought the hotel just opened. The care taken in the details and the green LEEDS approach is excellent. My room and how it functions exceeded expectations. I will return and recommend this to my friends and business associates.

Reviews.Title: “Bardessono, Napa Valley's latest resort, manages to be elegant, innovative, and truly green.”
Reviews.Author: conawayjim
Reviews.Content: Apparently no expense has been spared to provide what any intelligent traveler wants in a resort, including striking architecture, beautiful, native materials, and service, while employing cutting-edge technology to minimize environmental intrusion. Great ambience, innovative design, stunning cuisine, and genuinely caring service. This is a rare hotel that provides more in most categories while using up less of the natural resources we go to Napa Valleu to experience.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, spacious, and eco-friendly - but not really cozy”
Reviews.Author: raner
Reviews.Content: We were a little bit disappointed when we first entered our room at the Bardessono. The rooms are very modern and spacious but at the same time also somewhat stark and austere. The bed room and entrance area are entirely covered in concrete tiles, and the furnishing of the room is sparse and angular. In line with the Bardessono's commitment to the environment, the lighting inside the room is mainly fluorescent and LED, which produces a rather cold ambiance. The fire place is one of these modern gas fire places that consist of a single row of gas jets surrounded by some decorative glass pearls (the whole thing is behind a glass screen, so it doesn't even produce any significant heat). The bath room is very spacious with shower, jacuzzi, and two separate sinks/vanities. Both the shower and the jacuzzi have large floor-to-ceiling windows that provide you an unobstructed view to the outside. Unfortunately, there are two minor flaws with this design. First of all, there is not really much to see other than your private little garden area that is surrounded by a wooden fence. Second, the unobstructed view may work in both directions if your room is located near the roof-top patio: people on the patio can watch you taking your shower, and you better remember to let the blinds down, unless this kind of experience somehow turns you on. The hotel is in a very quiet area of Yountville (which, by itself, seems to be a very quiet place to begin with). However, we had some issues with noise sources in our own room. Instead of a mini bar, the rooms at the Bardessono are equipped with dual-temperature wine coolers that you can use to store the loot that you purchased at the local wineries in Napa Valley. The wine cooler is a handy feature for wine aficionados, but on the down-side it is the single most annoying noise-maker in the room. The wine cooler is integrated into the room furniture, and a small whining high-speed fan takes care of removing the excess heat. The fan is about as loud as a cheap desktop PC. Unplugging the cooler and the fan was about the first thing that I did after entering the room, but that might not be an option for those people who actually need to store some wine. The flat screen TV is equipped with some sort of add-on surround sound unit which makes some low-frequency humming noise even when the TV is off. This was not as bad as the wine cooler but bad enough to prevent us from falling asleep, so we unplugged the TV as well. Finally, speaking of annoying little noises, the fire place will make loud clanking sounds for about half an hour after you switch it off. Keep that in mind when you are planning to go to bed. The service at the Bardessono was pretty good without any major problems. The hotel offers free valet parking but unfortunately no self parking (essentially, you pay tips instead of parking fees). In the end, as always, whether or not you choose to stay at the Bardessono is a matter of personal preferences. If you enjoy an ascetic lifestyle and need a lot of space in your room to stretch out your yoga mat, then the Bardessono is a perfect choice. The same is true if you are environmentally conscious and prefer a hotel that shares those same ideas. However, if you want a cozy place with a warm atmosphere then there are probably other hotels in Napa Valley that would be better suited.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a 40th birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: JudyLasVegas
Reviews.Content: We had been anticipating the opening of this fabulous green hotel since I first read about it from staying at a sister hotel over a year ago--and we were not disappointed. Roger, the general manager, Paul the executive chef of the restaurant and staff were very professional, warm and friendly. Even with the rainy weather, the property was beautiful and fun. The style of the rooms is clean and modern with every possible new technology to make your stay easy--buttons available for the auto shutters, auto fireplace, steam shower, etc. We did a massage in our rooms which all have special accomodations for in-room massages and was above our expectations. Having it in-room allows you to continue to relax on the massage table as they leave quietly out the door when they are finished. The restaurant was fabulous and Paul the chef brilliant. They designed a 7 course custom wine/food tasting menu for a 14 person birthday celebration and every single inventive dish was delicious. The location is so perfect-no need to rent a car for eating as many great restaurants in walking distance including the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected for 500.00 a night!!!”
Reviews.Author: deanna1
Reviews.Content: My husband took me here for my Birthday and I was so excited since it looked so unique. Service was horrible. We walked in and they have what is called an unconventional check in...Ok that is fine except there is nobody around. The Valet which were very nice tell you to go have a seat in the lounge. There was a lady at the front computer checking in a couple and she seriously looked at me 5 times in a crazy way without even saying Hello. She then took the couple to there rooms as I sat there with my husband not even being addressed...I got up and asked the concierge who was sitting there doing absolutely nothing if she could help us?? She said No she did not know what to do...Finally, she goes and gets another lady who proceeds to help us. I explained to her what had happened and she was apologetic but that was it...We then had the concierge make us reservation at our favorite restaurant in Yountville Bistro Jeanty. We arrive and come to find out we had NO reservation...This place needs some HELP!!! The rooms are spacious and modern but nothing special...for 500.00 no view or anything...You can actually see into other people's windows..I commend them for being environmentally friendly however at this price the service is well below par. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: davidandrose1
Reviews.Content: I'll add to the well-deserved kudos for this new property. We travelled with our 11 year-old in one of the 2 queen-bedded rooms. The second bed was separated from the main bedroom-living room by a full wall that goes about half-way down the bed, offering a measure of enjoyable privacy. It also had a flat-screen of its own, and night tables, both of which she used. The technology in the rooms is impressive, whether the geothermal-based HVAC, 2 stage toilets, or self-closing and opening shades to keep the heat out when your not around. While many like to "push" green initiatives for the sake of being different, this hotel showed just how well energy-saving can blend into the background and only be noticed if you look or ask. Grounds are equally impressive, whether walking the herb garden (we asked the chef who was picking herbs about the evenings menu) or admiring the numerous water sculptures, plantings and just the architecture itself. The staff was incredible. Very smooth and polished for such a new place, and not overly formal nor were they casual to the point of "trying to be hip". Location in Yountville is ideal, and we across the street to Bouchon bakery every morning, and had other enjoyable dinners at Ad Hoc and Hurleys, also within walking distance. Very worthwhile property, and far better in my opinion than many more expensive properties (ie Auberge, Calistoga Ranch)
